I welcome the agreement with Andorra because we need to cooperate with as many countries as possible in order to tackle such problems more effectively.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 The report expresses the European Parliament's agreement to the international agreement by which the EU and the Principality of Andorra undertake an automatic exchange of information on their residents' financial accounts in order to increase efforts to combat fraud, avoidance and tax evasion.  In fact, the Principality of Andorra, together with other neighbouring states such as Switzerland, Lichtenstein, San Marino and Monaco, is one of the most sensitive countries for European tax evasion. Although the conclusion of an agreement on the exchange of financial information is to be considered an instrument due to the fight against evasion, the final text resulting from the negotiations between the EU and Andorra is highly unsatisfactory. There are still many regulatory gaps that can be easily circumvented and a more comprehensive agreement could have been reached. For these reasons, I have chosen to abstain from voting.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 We support the report on the agreement signed by the European Union and Andorra on 12 February 2016 on the automatic exchange of financial account information, which aims to improve international tax cooperation and compliance. The agreement is an important step in ongoing efforts to combat tax fraud and tax evasion and upgrades the 2004 agreement that ensured Andorra implements measures equivalent to those provided for in an EU directive on taxation of savings income.

name: Kostas CHRYSOGONOS
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 The draft resolution on the proposal for a Council Decision on the conclusion of an amending Protocol to the Agreement between the European Community and the Principality of Andorra providing for measures to tax savings income in the form of interest payments is part of the process of smooth cooperation between the two sides. As In recent years Europe has experienced very negatively the effects of the lack of specific structures and regulations in the field of combating tax evasion, I believe that such efforts contribute to the rationalisation of procedures and I have therefore decided to vote in favour.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of this report because it represents an important step forward in the ongoing efforts to combat tax fraud and evasion. In fact, the agreement is intended to ensure that Andorra applies enhanced measures equivalent to those provided for in the EU legal framework. As a result of this agreement, the tax administrations of the Member States and Andorra will be able to correctly and unequivocally identify the taxpayers concerned, apply and enforce their tax legislation in cross-border situations, assess the likelihood of tax evasion, avoid further unnecessary investigations.  I always remain of the opinion that public ballast must be reduced from the shoulders of citizens and businesses, but at the same time I do not accept that those who escape face unfair competition from those who contribute to the financing of a country's public services.

name: Deirdre CLUNE
text: in writing. ‒ Following the adoption of Council Directive 2003/48/EC (the Savings Directive), and in order to preserve the level playing field of economic operators, the EU signed an Agreement with the Principality of Andorra providing for measures equivalent to those laid down in the Directive. The Commission adopted on 17 June 2011 a recommendation for a mandate to initiate negotiations with the Principality of Andorra in order to upgrade the EU’s Agreements with those countries in line with international developments and to ensure that those countries continue to apply measures equivalent to those in the EU.  The report consents to the conclusion of the agreement. Under this proposal, the Council is called upon to approve, on behalf of the European Union, the Amending Protocol to the Agreement between the European Community and the Principality of Andorra providing for measures equivalent to those laid down in Council Directive 2003/48/EC on taxation of savings income in the form of interest payments.

name: David COBURN
text: in writing. ‒ Treaties and agreements entered into by the EU could just as easily be entered into by Member States directly, UKIP opposes the authority of the EU to act in its own legal capacity in this fashion, accordingly UKIP voted against.

name: Birgit COLLIN-LANGEN
text: Writing. I voted in favour of the resolution because the agreement is an important step in the fight against tax fraud and tax evasion. The automatic exchange of information on financial accounts makes it more difficult for taxpayers to hide capital for which no taxes have been paid. I therefore welcome the fact that the EU is stepping up its cooperation with its neighbours, such as.B Liechtenstein, so that there will soon be no more tax loopholes.

name: Jane COLLINS
text: in writing. – Treaties and agreements entered into by the EU could just as easily be entered into by Member States directly, UKIP opposes the authority of the EU to act in its own legal capacity in this fashion, accordingly UKIP voted against.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing. \u2012 I have decided to vote in favour of this proposal because, following the new agreement between the EU and Andorra, mutual tax administrations will be able to apply and enforce their tax legislation in cross-border situations, assess the likelihood of tax evasion and avoid further unnecessary investigations. This agreement represents an important step forward in the ongoing efforts to combat tax fraud and evasion and to improve the 2004 agreement guaranteeing andorra's application of measures equivalent to those contained in the EU Directive on the taxation of savings income.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. ‒ I support the call for Andorra to comply with the procedures for automatic exchange of financial account information promoted by the 2014 OECD Global standard.  This will be of reciprocal benefit. On the basis of this new agreement our European tax administrations and those in Andorra will be able to identify correctly and unequivocally the taxpayers concerned, enforce our tax laws in cross-border situations and avoid unnecessary financial investigations

name: Ignazio CORRAO
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Union and the Principality of Andorra have signed an agreement on the automatic exchange of financial information for tax purposes aimed at improving cooperation and compliance with tax obligations at international level. This is the fourth in a package of five agreements, covering Switzerland, Liechtenstein, San Marino, Andorra and Monaco. Although these agreements improve on the status quo, they are still a long way from resolving most of the existing problems with all these countries in practice.  On the basis of this agreement, the EU and the Principality of Andorra will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts of their residents, in order to increase efforts to combat fraud, avoidance and tax evasion, which they see as one of the most sensitive countries in these respects. The text is unsatisfactory, incomplete and in-depth, as this still leaves a number of regulatory gaps that can be easily circumvented. That is why I preferred to abstain during the vote in plenary.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this report because it presents a tax cooperation agreement between Andorra and the EU which improves this legislative framework and extends the exchange of tax information. While the exchange of information cannot be the only axis of action in tax matters at EU level and we consider the full abolition of such tax havens necessary, the agreement voted here unquestionably improves the current functioning of the exchange of information with Andorra, clarifying responsibilities in the sheer tax evasion that takes place through this tax haven. Despite its manifest inadequacy, the formalisation of such agreements is necessary to know the real dimension of fraud and tax evasion of European taxpayers in such jurisdictions. That's why I've decided to vote for it.

name: Andi CRISTEA
text: in writing. \u2012 Cooperation with partner states to crack down on tax havens, fraud and tax evasion is of major importance to the European Union and the Member States. The automatic exchange of information procedures established by this agreement aim at correctly identifying fraud situations and assessing the likelihood of committing tax evasion. Strengthening tax legislation in cross-border situations reduces the possibilities for the transfer of illicit funds and the use of neighbouring states as tax havens. I support the signing of the agreement, drawing attention to the importance of concluding similar agreements with the States located in the Eastern Neighbourhood.

name: Pál CSÁKY
text: Writing. \u2012 On 12 February 2016, the European Union and Andorra signed an agreement on the automatic exchange of financial account information aimed at improving international tax cooperation and compliance. The agreement represents an important step in efforts to combat tax fraud and evasion. Under the new agreement, member states and andorra tax authorities will be able to identify the taxpayers concerned accurately and unequivocally, perform the tasks arising from their tax legislation in cross-border situations and enforce them, assess the likelihood of committing tax evasion and avoid unnecessary further investigations. The European Parliament approved the conclusion of the Protocol amending the Agreement by voting today. The planned cooperation will take effect on 1 January 2017.

name: Edward CZESAK
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 The EU and the Principality of Andorra will automatically exchange financial information on the other party's residents in accordance with the updated requirements set out in the Administrative Cooperation Directive and the 2014 OECD Global Standards. This will take place from 2017. The aim is to remedy situations in which the taxpayer attempts to conceal capital constituting income or assets from which no taxes have been paid. Similar updates have been made to the agreements with Switzerland, Liechtenstein and San Marino, and the agreement with Monaco will also be updated. Work on the report was carried out through a simplified procedure (Article 50 of the Rules of Procedure).  This update is to be welcomed as the agreement has been adapted to current EU and OECD global standards, without applying double standards to the exchange of information. I voted in favour of this document.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ The need for more transparency on tax issues in the EU and in its relations with third countries needs to be addressed and ensured by the introduction and proper implementation of solid agreements. The agreement between the European Union and Andorra signed on 12 February 2016, stipulates the automatic exchange of financial account information and represents an important step to clamp down on tax fraud and tax evasion. I voted in favour of this report, as it aims to address situations where a taxpayer seeks to hide capital or assets for which taxes have not been paid. This introduces further transparency and compliance between the European Union and Andorra.

name: Michel DANTIN
text: In writing. This report proposes to ratify the EU-Andorra agreement to end banking secrecy between EU Member States and the Principality of Andorra. To this end, the text provides for the automatic exchange of information on clients' financial accounts. Considering that bank secrecy and tax evasion undermine the financial interests of the Union, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Rachida DATI
text: In writing. It is important that the Union strengthens its cooperation with the Principality of Andorra, particularly in the exchange of information on financial accounts in order to prevent any attempt to conceal income and non-payment of taxes by a taxpayer. I therefore voted in favour of this text.

name: Andor DELI
text: Writing. \u2012 On 12 February 2016, the European Union and Andorra signed an agreement on the automatic exchange of financial account information aimed at improving international tax cooperation and compliance. The agreement represents an important step in efforts to combat tax fraud and evasion and updates the 2004 agreement to ensure that Andorra applies measures equivalent to the EU Directive on the taxation of savings interest income.  Under the new agreement, an automatic exchange of information on data collected between EU Member States and Andorra from 2018 onwards, starting on 1 January 2017, will be established in respect of the financial accounts of citizens of another country held in the territory of one country. The aim is to address situations where taxable persons seek to conceal capital conbodied in the sense of income or property for which the tax has not yet been paid. Under the new agreement, member states and andorra tax authorities will be able to identify the taxpayers concerned accurately and unequivocally; be able to carry out and enforce the tasks arising from their tax legislation in cross-border situations; assess the likelihood of tax evasion being committed; avoid unnecessary further investigations.

name: Gérard DEPREZ
text: In writing. I supported the agreement between the EU and the Principality of Andorra to combat tax evasion and evasion. According to the agreement, which is in line with other transparency agreements, the EU and Andorra will now automatically exchange information on the financial accounts of their respective residents (from 2018 for information collected since 1 January 2017). This information will relate to income as well as bank balances and receipts from the sale of capital. Thus, the Principality of Andorra will soon apply measures equivalent to those in force in the EU since March 2014 and will also comply with the 2014 global standard on the automatic exchange of financial account information, promoted by the OECD.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. I have decided to vote for this text insofar as it aims to combat so-called ordinary tax evasion, i.e. the concealment of income or assets in order to avoid their taxation. The aim here is to validate an agreement which provides that the European Union and the Principality of Andorra will automatically exchange information on the accounts of their respective residents from 2017. With this vote, we are continuing the logic of the agreements with Switzerland, Liechtenstein and San Marino on tax transparency.

name: Angel DZHAMBAZKI
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I supported the agreement between the European Union and Andorra on the exchange of information on citizens' financial data according to the new requirements of the Administrative Cooperation Directive and the CEFR Standards of 2014. I believe that this agreement is a step in the right direction to combat financial fraud and tax evasion that seriously harm the EU Treasury.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 States must conclud transnational agreements in order to be able quickly, reliably and always in accordance with the laws to investigate and deliver justice in cases of financial crimes. The European Union must help states in this effort in such a way that their sovereign rights are not violated.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. \u2012 The agreement, on which the European Parliament was consulted, updates another concluded between the EU and Andorra in 2004, which ensured that the Principality would apply measures equivalent to those provided for in the EU Directive on the taxation of savings income. The aim is to prevent situations where a taxpayer tries to hide capital corresponding to income or assets for which no tax has been paid. Under the new agreement, the tax administrations of the Member States and Andorra will be able to correctly identify the taxpayers concerned, enforce and enforce their tax laws in cross-border situations, assess the likelihood of tax evasion and dispense with unnecessary additional investigations.

name: Jonás FERNÁNDEZ
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this international agreement with Andorra on the automatic exchange of tax information because it is a major step forward in combating tax evasion and avoidance, particularly in third States by natural or legal persons who are nationals of a Member State of the Union.  The European and Spanish Socialists are firmly committed to the definitive abolition of tax havens in the world, and particularly within or on the margins of the European Union, as they erode the financing of the welfare state and, ultimately, social justice.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: In writing. I voted for this text, which is in the logic of our positions on the end of banking secrecy in Europe.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. \u2012 This agreement follows other, identical, previously signed and which we have also voted in favour of. The signed agreement on the automatic exchange of account and financial interest information, which aims, among other things, to improve international tax cooperation, represents an important step in ongoing efforts to combat tax fraud and tax evasion. Under the new agreement, Andorra and the EU will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts of each person's residents. The aim is to address situations where a taxpayer seeks to hide his sources of untaxed financial income. The agreement aims to ensure that Andorra applies measures that are equivalent to the legal framework of the European Union and the OECD. We recognise the positive (though limited) aspects that may result.

name: Raffaele FITTO
text: in writing. \u2012 The protocol represents an important step forward in the efforts of the EU and the Principality of Andorra to combat tax fraud and evasion. I welcome the fact that the agreement has been brought into line with the overall standards of the EU and the OSCE and that, in the event of an exchange of information, rules are applied in favour of the principle of transparency.  I voted in favour of this agreement, as I am convinced that it will bring mutual benefits to both parties in question, in particular the ability to enforce tax legislation in cross-border situations and to assess the likelihood of tax evasion.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: in writing ‒ I welcome the conclusion of the Agreement on taxation of savings income in the form of interest payments between the European Union and the Principality of Andorra. The main objective of the agreement in question between the European Union and the Principality of Andorra is to improve cooperation in the field of tax compliance. Under the Agreement on taxation of savings income in the form of interest payments, the Member States of the European Union and Andorra will exchange information on financial accounts, thereby preventing capital transfers between countries.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. \u2012 Vote in favour of the report on the AGREEMENT between the EU and Andorra to ensure greater cooperation in the EU tax field.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 States must conclud transnational agreements in order to be able quickly, reliably and always in accordance with the laws to investigate and deliver justice in cases of financial crimes. The European Union must help states in this effort in such a way that their sovereign rights are not violated. For these reasons, I am voting in favour of this report.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ This agreement is in line with the need for more transparency on tax issues in the EU and in its relations with third countries. Tax administrations in the Member States and in Andorra will be able to identify correctly and unequivocally the taxpayers concerned, administer and enforce their tax laws in cross-border situations, assess the likelihood of tax evasion being perpetrated and avoid unnecessary further investigations.

name: Francisco de Paula GAMBUS MILLET
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this report as this agreement is a step forward in cooperation between Andorra and the EU on taxation. This agreement enables the fight against tax evasion and evasion by automatically exchanging information on the financial accounts between the Union and Andorra of their respective residents from 2018. It is vital to continue working to achieve greater fiscal transparency, to combat tax evasion and money laundering.

name: Iratxe GARCÍA PÉREZ
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this international agreement with Andorra on the automatic exchange of tax information because it is a major step forward in combating tax evasion and avoidance, in particular that which takes place in third States by natural or legal persons who are nationals of a Member State of the Union.  The European and Spanish Socialists are firmly committed to the definitive abolition of tax havens in the international community, and particularly in the European Union, because they erode the state's financing of welfare and social justice.

name: Eider GARDIAZABAL RUBIAL
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this international agreement with Andorra on the automatic exchange of tax information because it is a major step forward in combating tax evasion and avoidance, particularly in third States by natural or legal persons who are nationals of a Member State of the Union.  The European and Spanish Socialists are firmly committed to the definitive abolition of tax havens in the world, and particularly within or on the margins of the European Union, as they erode the financing of the welfare state and, ultimately, social justice.

name: Elena GENTILE
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the EP legislative resolution on the proposal for a Council decision on the conclusion, on behalf of the EU, of the Protocol amending the Agreement between the European Community and the Principality of Andorra laying down measures equivalent to those laid down in Council Directive 2003/48/EC on the taxation of savings income in the form of interest payments, because I strongly agree with the improvements made by the new agreement. The agreement is intended to ensure that Andorra applies enhanced measures equivalent to those provided for in the EU legal framework, as updated in December 2014, and complies with the procedures for the automatic exchange of financial account information promoted by the 2014 OECD Global Standard. Andorra, in turn, reformed the national tax system with the introduction of a tax on the income of resident natural persons. The agreement is in line with oecd standard, the additional provisions of the agreement aim to ensure that the information exchanged relates not only to income such as interest and dividends, but also to account balances and proceeds from sales of financial assets. The new agreement also provides for the unconditional exchange of information on request, in accordance with the latest developments in the work of the OECD and the EU in this area.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: Writing. The agreement is an important step towards combating tax fraud and tax evasion through the automatic exchange of information. It will also ensure the timeliness of the 2004 agreement and the security of the application of equivalent rules.

name: Nathan GILL
text: in writing. ‒ Treaties and agreements entered into by the EU could just as easily be entered into by Member States directly. UKIP opposes the authority of the EU to act in its own legal capacity in this fashion; accordingly UKIP voted against.

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report. In recent times we have heard instances of corporate tax evasion and ‘sweetheart’ tax deals so it is welcome to hear of this arrangement between the EU and Andorra. The automatic sharing of information as of 2018 will help in the global fight against aggressive tax planning. In the UK in 2013/2014 the tax gap (total of tax debt, avoidance and corporate evasion) was GBP 119.4 billion. We need a European response to a pan-European problem, including through agreements like this proposal. In order to take effective action in this area the UK must remain a member of the EU.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report, which establishes an agreement between the Union and Andorra establishing a cooperation framework for the exchange of convergent tax information with which it already operates between Member States. This agreement relates only to interest taxes received by savers as creditors. The agreement moves forward to combat tax avoidance and tax evasion and facilitate transparency.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I support these measures because tax fraud and tax evasion are serious problems, and giving these stronger powers to tax administrations in both Andorra and the EU Member States will strengthen our ability to fight these crimes. It will be of mutual benefit to all of us.

name: Sergio GUTIÉRREZ PRIETO
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this international agreement with Andorra on the automatic exchange of tax information because it is a major step forward in combating tax evasion and avoidance, particularly in third States by natural or legal persons who are nationals of a Member State of the Union.  The European and Spanish Socialists are firmly committed to the definitive abolition of tax havens in the world, and particularly within or on the margins of the European Union, as they erode the financing of the welfare state and, ultimately, social justice.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 The report concerns an agreement between the EU and the Principality of Andorra on taxation of savings income in the form of interest payments. Positive elements in the report were that tax services on each side will now be able to identify more easily the taxpayers they are talking about, will be easier to apply their tax laws in cross-border cases, to combat tax avoidance more effectively and finally to coordinate their investigations in cases of tax avoidance. In our positions in favour of tax transparency, we voted in favour of the report.

name: Marian HARKIN
text: in writing. ‒ I supported this report as the agreement between the EU and Andorra represents an important step in ongoing efforts to clamp down on tax fraud and tax evasion. Under the new agreement, the EU and Andorra will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts held on their territories by each other’s residents, starting in 2018 for information collected since 1 January 2017. The aim is to address situations where a taxpayer seeks to hide capital representing income or assets for which taxes have not been paid.  The agreement aims at ensuring that Andorra applies strengthened measures that are equivalent to the EU legal framework and that comply with the procedures for automatic exchange of financial account information promoted by the 2014 OECD Global standard. It will also benefit Andorra which has recently reformed its domestic tax system with the introduction of personal income taxation for its residents. As a result of the new agreement, tax administrations in the Member States and in Andorra will be able to: identify correctly and unequivocally the taxpayers concerned; administer and enforce their tax laws in cross-border situations; assess the likelihood of tax evasion being perpetrated and avoid unnecessary further investigations.

name: Brian HAYES
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report as I believe this represents a positive example of the two contracting parties building on their long-standing relationship with respect to mutual assistance in tax matters. This Protocol will help to contribute to the improvement of general international tax compliance and is based on the reciprocal automatic exchange of information.

name: Mike HOOKEM
text: in writing. ‒ Treaties and agreements entered into by the EU could just as easily be entered into by Member States directly. UKIP opposes the authority of the EU to act in its own legal capacity in this fashion; accordingly UKIP voted against.

name: Brice HORTEFEUX
text: In writing. I am pleased that the European Parliament has approved the agreement with the Principality of Andorra to combat tax evasion from 2017. The aim is to align tax laws and formalize an automatic exchange of information between the Andorran and European authorities in order to fight fraud more effectively.  In France, the government is demanding considerable efforts from households to put the country back on the path to growth.  I believe that the counterpart of these measures must be the hunt for fraudsters who have caused Europe to lose more than 1 trillion euros and france to lose between 60 and 80 billion euros, according to 2013 estimates.

name: Cătălin Sorin IVAN
text: in writing. ‒ In order to improve international tax cooperation and compliance, the EU and Andorra signed an agreement on 12 February 2016 on the automatic exchange of financial account information. An automatic exchange of information on financial accounts will start in 2018. This should reduce the possibility for tax evasion. I voted in favour of this report.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for the European Parliament's draft legislative resolution on the Proposal for a Council Decision on the Conclusion, on behalf of the European Union, the Amending Protocol to the Agreement between the European Community and the Principality of Andorra on measures equivalent to those set out in Council Directive 2003/48/EC on the taxation of interest income on savings, as this prevents tax fraud and tax evasion, and improves international tax cooperation.  It also allows EU member states and Andorra to exchange information on financial accounts relating not only to income but also to account balances and revenues from the sale of financial assets. In doing so, Andorra applies rules equivalent to the EU legal framework, and I therefore support this report.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: In writing. The aim here is to validate the agreement signed on 12 February 2016 between the EU and Andorra on the automatic exchange of information relating to financial accounts, aimed at increasing tax cooperation and compliance with international tax obligations. The text provides that the European Union and Andorra will automatically exchange information on the accounts of their respective residents from 1 January 2017. The aim is always to deal with "ordinary" tax evasion, i.e. the concealment of income or assets in order to avoid their taxation. In accordance with OECD standards, the agreement provides that the information exchanged relates not only to savings income (interest and dividends), but also to account balances and proceeds from the sale of financial assets. In the logic of our positions on the end of banking secrecy in Europe (Switzerland, Liechtenstein, San Marino), it seems logical to be in favour of it. I voted in favour of this text.

name: Diane JAMES
text: in writing. – Treaties and agreements entered into by the EU could just as easily be entered into by Member States directly. UKIP opposes the authority of the EU to act in its own legal capacity in this fashion; accordingly UKIP voted against.

name: Ramón JÁUREGUI ATONDO
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this international agreement with Andorra on the automatic exchange of tax information because it is a major step forward in combating tax evasion and avoidance, particularly in third States by natural or legal persons who are nationals of a Member State of the Union.  The European and Spanish Socialists are firmly committed to the definitive abolition of tax havens in the world, and particularly within or on the margins of the European Union, as they erode the financing of the welfare state and, ultimately, social justice.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. I voted in favour of my colleague Miguel Viegas' report on the EU-Andorra agreement on the automatic exchange of financial account information. The European Union has developed this agreement for greater tax transparency in the exchange of information between administrations. I support these exchanges of information between the administrations of the European Union and Andorra, which are essential for the fight against fraud and tax evasion. This report was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report, which aims to set up an automatic system of exchange of tax-related information between the EU and Andorra. This will help to combat the many taxpayers seeking to hide their capital in the Principality of Andorra to evade tax, and to strengthen the fight against fraud and tax evasion in Europe.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. The report provides for an amendment to the existing 2004 agreement to combat tax fraud and tax evasion. I agree with the suggestions for improvement contained therein.

name: Afzal KHAN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of approving the agreement between the EU and Andorra because it is vital, in the global fight against aggressive tax planning and tax evasion, that we work with countries like Andorra in order to make sure that no one can dodge taxes simply by hiding their money overseas.

name: Stelios KOULOGLOU
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 I welcome the Union's ongoing efforts to combat tax evasion and fraud and the procedures for cooperation and compliance of Member States. In this context, the agreement of 12 February with Andorra on the automatic exchange of financial account information is an important step in this direction. The new agreement then benefits Andorra, which has recently reformed its domestic tax system, as well as the tax authorities of the Member States, which, in cooperation with the andorran homologous authorities, will be able to exchange information on the correct identification of the accounts held on their territory by the holders of the other Party.  I therefore voted in favour of the report.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. On 12 February 2016, the European Union and Andorra signed an agreement on the automatic exchange of financial information for tax purposes, aimed at improving cooperation and compliance with tax obligations at international level. I have chosen to vote in favour of Mr Viegas' report because this agreement aims to combat tax evasion and fraud by means of stricter monitoring of the financial accounts in the name of their residents. Andorra will also have to adopt enhanced measures equivalent to those provided for in the EU legal framework, in line with the procedures promoted by the 2014 OECD standard. Compliance with the latter will lead Andorra to ensure an automatic exchange of information on account balances and proceeds from sales of financial assets.

name: Gabrielius LANDSBERGIS
text: Writing. \u2012 This Agreement is important to ensure cooperation in the fight against fraud, tax avoidance and income evasion. Under the agreement, Andorra and the EU will automatically exchange information on financial accounts in accordance with international standards. Once the draft and ratification of the agreement have been completed in time, it should enter into force as early as 2017.

name: Marine LE PEN
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the report on the EU-Andorra agreement on the automatic exchange of financial account information. The aim here is to validate the agreement signed on 12 February 2016 between the EU and Andorra on the automatic exchange of information relating to financial accounts, aimed at increasing tax cooperation and compliance with international tax obligations. The text provides that the European Union and Andorra will automatically exchange information on the accounts of their respective residents from 1 January 2017. The aim is to deal with "ordinary" tax evasion, i.e. the concealment of income or assets in order to avoid their taxation. In accordance with OECD standards, the agreement provides that the information exchanged relates not only to savings income (interest and dividends), but also to account balances and proceeds from the sale of financial assets.

name: Gilles LEBRETON
text: In writing. I voted for this report because it promotes a tax transparency agreement with Andorra.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: In writing. I spoke out in favour of this text. Indeed, it validates the agreement signed on 12 February 2016 by the European Union and Andorra. It implements the automatic exchange of financial account information, which improves tax cooperation and compliance with international tax obligations. According to OECD standards, the agreement organises the exchange of information between savings income, account balances and proceeds from the sale of financial assets, and continues the fight against "ordinary" tax evasion (concealment of income or assets to avoid taxation). I wanted to support this desire for transparency.

name: Javi LÓPEZ
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this international agreement with Andorra on the automatic exchange of tax information because it is a major step forward in combating tax evasion and avoidance, particularly in third States by natural or legal persons who are nationals of a Member State of the Union.  The European and Spanish Socialists are firmly committed to the definitive abolition of tax havens in the world, and particularly within or on the margins of the European Union, as they erode the financing of the welfare state and, ultimately, social justice.

name: Juan Fernando LÓPEZ AGUILAR
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this international agreement with Andorra on the automatic exchange of tax information because it is a major step forward in combating tax evasion and avoidance, particularly in third States by natural or legal persons who are nationals of a Member State of the Union.  The European and Spanish Socialists are firmly committed to the definitive abolition of tax havens in the world, and particularly within or on the margins of the European Union, as they erode the financing of the welfare state and, ultimately, social justice.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this report because it presents a tax cooperation agreement between Andorra and the EU which improves this legislative framework and extends the exchange of tax information. While the exchange of information cannot be the only axis of action in tax matters at EU level and we consider the full abolition of such tax havens necessary, the agreement voted here unquestionably improves the current functioning of the exchange of information with Andorra, clarifying responsibilities in the sheer tax evasion that takes place through this tax haven. Despite its manifest inadequacy, the formalisation of such agreements is necessary to know the real dimension of fraud and tax evasion of European taxpayers in such jurisdictions. That's why I've decided to vote for it.

name: Antonio LÓPEZ-ISTÚRIZ WHITE
text: in writing. Thanks to the Agreement signed on 12 February 2016, the Member States of the Union and Andorra will exchange information on the financial accounts of their respective residents from 2018 with the aim of combating tax evasion and evasion.  The aim of this report is to avoid situations in which a citizen tries to hide a wealth consisting of assets or income on which no taxes have been paid.  The signing of this agreement implies that the tax administrations of Andorra and the Member States are empowered, inter alia, to: - Assess the likelihood that tax evasion is being committed. - Enforce the respective tax laws in cross-border situations. I strongly judge these measures and vote in favour of this report as the adoption of this report will improve fiscal cooperation and compliance with tax obligations at the international level.

name: Petr MACH
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted against. I do not agree with the principle that Member States and Andorra should automatically exchange data on taxpayers' bank accounts. Nor do I agree with the principle that Andorra should have to pay interest tax on deposits to the governments of depositors. I consider automatic exchange to be spying on citizens and paying taxes for bullying a small state. If individual states want such an agreement, I do not agree that the EU should be a party.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. The European Union and Andorra signed a contract on 12 February 2016 on the automatic exchange of financial information with a view to improving international cooperation. The agreement is a step towards introducing tougher measures against tax fraud and evasion. Under the new agreement, Andorra would automatically exchange information on the financial accounts of its residents starting in 2018, with data to be collected from 1 January 2017. This would ensure that no taxpayer could conceal capital representing income or assets and would pay tax for each capital. I supported the Agreement between the European Community and Andorra as it complies with the oecd provisions. The data will not only relate to income, such as interest rate and dividend, but also to account balances and revenues from the sale of financial assets.

name: Vladimír MAŇKA
text: in writing ‒ in 2004, the EU and Andorra concluded an agreement committing Andorra to apply the same savings income taxation measures as those introduced in the EU. By agreement of February 2016, Andorra and the EU committed themselves to mutually exchanging information on residents' financial accounts from 2018, with the exchange of information related to data acquired from 1 January 2017. I support the conclusion of this agreement with the Principality of Andorra, which is one of the steps to combat fraud and the concealment of property and income for which no tax has been paid. The agreement will help the tax authorities of the Contracting Parties to exercise greater and more rigorous control in the application of tax laws in cross-border cases.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 Abstained from voting on the report on the proposal for a Council Decision on the conclusion, on behalf of the European Union, of the amending Protocol to the Agreement between the European Community and the Principality of Andorra providing for measures equivalent to those laid down in Council Directive 2003/48/EC on taxation of savings income in the form of interest payments, because it is not complete but also does not effectively combat tax evasion and avoidance, as it is based on OECD standards, which are known to allow the existence of 'grey zones', thus facilitating tax evasion and avoidance not only of different individuals but also of multinational enterprises through known triangular relations.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: In writing. I voted for this text. The aim here was to validate the agreement signed on 12 February 2016 between the EU and Andorra on the automatic exchange of information relating to financial accounts, on the bus to increase tax cooperation and compliance with international tax obligations. The agreement provides that the EU and Andorra will automatically exchange information on the accounts of their respective residents from 1 January 2017. We had already supported similar agreements for Switzerland, Liechtenstein and San Marino; so it makes sense for us to continue.

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted for this proposal as the agreement represents an important step in ongoing efforts to clamp down on tax fraud and tax evasion and upgrades the 2004 agreement that ensured that Andorra applied measures equivalent to those in an EU directive on the taxation of savings income.

name: Barbara MATERA
text: in writing. \u2012 Cooperating in financial matters with Andorra is a step in the right direction. This agreement is certainly in the interests of our taxpayers. For these reasons, I voted in favour.

name: Gabriel MATO
text: in writing. I support the agreement reached with Andorra for the automatic exchange of information on bank accounts that EU residents have in Andorra and vice versa. The exchange of data will be very useful to prevent Community citizens from hiding their money from the treasury in Andorra.

name: Valentinas MAZURONIS
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the proposal for an AGREEMENT between the EU and Andorra on the automatic exchange of financial account information. This agreement is important in the fight against tax fraud and tax evasion. Under the new agreement, from 2018, the EU and Andorra will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts held by the EU and Andorra residents in their territories. The aim is thus to respond to cases where the taxpayer attempts to conceal capital consisting of income or assets for which no taxes have been paid.

name: Mairead McGUINNESS
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this report that supports upgrading the EU’s Agreements with the Principality of Andorra, and ensuring that the same or equivalent standards to the EU are applied.

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: In writing. The vote was to validate the exchange of financial information from residents in order to combat the concealment of income or assets. The agreement is comprehensive, as it also takes into account account balances and income from asset sales, as required by OECD standards. This report is in line with our positions on previous votes for the end of banking secrecy in Europe. As a result, I voted for it.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. The agreement on the automatic exchange of information on financial accounts is essential to improve tax cooperation in the context of tax evasion and evasion.  I have presented my vote in favour.

name: Roberta METSOLA
text: in writing. ‒ I support this agreement, which aims at improving international tax cooperation and compliance. The automatic exchange of financial account information will help the efforts to prevent tax fraud and tax evasion.

name: Louis MICHEL
text: In writing. Tax evasion is now a major challenge. It contributes to the erosion of public finances. To avoid this, it is essential to put in place mechanisms to put an end to these practices of fund-coverting. I am pleased that the European Parliament has approved the new agreement between the EU and Andorra, which will ensure an automatic exchange of information relating to the financial accounts of their respective residents. We need to make sure that taxes are actually paid. For this, bilateral cooperation will not be enough. Multilateral and global initiatives must become the priority.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour of the report on EU-Andorra agreement on the automatic exchange of financial account information because it is in line with the need for more transparency on tax issues in the EU and in its relations with third countries.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 The EU and Andorra agreed in 2004 that the Principality should apply measures equivalent to the EU Directive on the taxation of savings interest income. On 12 February 2016, an agreement was signed to establish an automatic exchange of information between EU Member States and Andorra on data collected from 1 January 2017 onwards in respect of the financial accounts of citizens of another country held in one country' territory, starting in 2018. The aim is to address situations where taxable persons seek to conceal capital conbodied in the sense of income or property for which the tax has not yet been paid. The Council has submitted a proposal for a decision to ratify the Agreement. In its report, the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs recommends that Parliament approve the conclusion of the Protocol amending the Agreement. I voted accordingly.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: In writing. The aim here is to validate the agreement signed on 12 February 2016 between the EU and Andorra on the automatic exchange of information relating to financial accounts, aimed at increasing tax cooperation and compliance with tax obligations at international level. The text provides that the European Union and Andorra will automatically exchange information on the accounts of their respective residents from 1 January 2017.  The aim is always to deal with "ordinary" tax evasion, i.e. the concealment of income or assets in order to avoid their taxation. In accordance with OECD standards, the agreement provides that the information exchanged relates not only to savings income (interest and dividends), but also to account balances and proceeds from the sale of financial assets.  In the logic of our positions on the end of banking secrecy in Europe (Switzerland, Liechtenstein, San Marino), this text should be supported.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Union and the Principality of Andorra signed an agreement on the automatic exchange of information on financial accounts on 12 February 2016 with a view to improving tax cooperation and compliance with international tax obligations. The Agreement marks significant progress in efforts to combat tax fraud and tax evasion and updates the 2004 agreement, which ensured the implementation of measures equivalent to those provided for in the EU Directive on the taxation of savings income by the Principality of Andorra. The proposed amendment to the Agreement provides that EU Member States and Andorra, from 2018 on, will automatically exchange the information collected from 1 January 2017 on the financial accounts held in their territories by residents of the other Party. The purpose of this exchange is to prevent situations where a taxpayer tries to hide capital corresponding to income or assets for which no tax has been paid. For the foregoing, this report deserves my vote in favour.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. This report aims to endorse the agreement signed on 12 February 2016 between EU members and Andorra on the automatic exchange of financial information from 1 January 2017, aimed at increasing tax cooperation and the fight against tax evasion at the international level. In the wake of my opposition to the practice of bank secrecy in Europe and wishing to curb fraudulent financial practices, I voted in favour of this text.

name: Claude MORAES
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of approving the Agreement between the EU and Andorra because it is vital, in the global fight against aggressive tax planning and tax evasion, that we work with countries like Andorra in order to make sure that no one can dodge taxes simply by hiding their money overseas.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this text, which approves the conclusion of the agreement reached on 12 February 2016 between Andorra and the European Union on the automatic exchange of information relating to financial accounts. The new agreement provides that EU Member States and Andorra will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts of their respective residents, starting in 2018 for information collected since 1 January 2017. The aim of this agreement is to combat tax evasion and evasion, which harm the financial interests of the European Union and cause harm to taxpayers.

name: Renaud MUSELIER
text: In writing. I was not able, for medical reasons, to attend the plenary session from 7 to 10 March 2016. Nevertheless, I would like to express my support for the agreement signed with the Principality of Andorra allowing the automatic exchange of information relating to financial accounts, according to the measures set out in the Council directive.

name: József NAGY
text: Writing. \u2012 I welcome the report on the automatic exchange of financial account information, which serves as a new tool for detecting and preventing activities committed for the purpose of tax fraud or evasion. Thanks to the agreement between the European Union and Andorra, the country will be able to carry out cross-border tax-related tasks more effectively, to detect tax evasion activities as soon as possible and to clearly identify taxpayers involved in such matters.

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ On 12 February 2016 the European Union and Andorra signed an agreement regarding the automatic exchange of financial account information, aimed at improving international tax cooperation and compliance. With this agreement, the EU Member States and Andorra will have the possibility to automatically exchange information on the financial accounts held on their territories by each other’s residents from 2018. I have voted for this report that aims to address situations where a taxpayer seeks to hide capital representing income or assets for which taxes have not been paid.

name: Dan NICA
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Union and Andorra signed an agreement on 12 February 2016 on the automatic exchange of information on financial accounts, with the aim of improving tax cooperation and compliance with tax rules at international level. The Agreement will enter into force provisionally from 1 January 2017. The agreement is an important step in current efforts to combat tax fraud and evasion. Under the new agreement, the EU Member States and Andorra will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts held in their territory by their respective residents. The purpose of this approach is to deal with situations where the taxpayer tries to hide capital representing income or assets for which no taxes have been paid. At the same time, the agreement aims to ensure that Andorra applies enhanced measures equivalent to those provided for in the EU legal framework and that it complies with the automatic exchange of information on financial accounts. As a result of the new agreement, the tax authorities of the Member States and Andorra will be able to: correctly and unequivocally identify the taxpayers concerned; manage and enforce national tax laws in cross-border situations;  assess the likelihood of tax evasion;  avoid unnecessary further investigations.

name: Franz OBERMAYR
text: Writing. The report aims to amend the existing 2004 agreement on combating tax fraud and tax evasion and contains some suggestions for improvement, with which I agree.

name: Urmas PAET
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported. The exchange of financial account data facilitates international tax cooperation, which is essential to prevent tax fraud. This Agreement replaces the previous 2004 Agreement.

name: Rolandas PAKSAS
text: Writing. \u2012 I support the conclusion of an agreement on the automatic exchange of financial account information between the EU and the Principality of Andorra. This agreement will strengthen mutual cooperation between the parties in line with and ensure proper compliance with high and high EU standards. Tax administrations will be better able to identify the relevant taxpayers fairly and clearly and to facilitate the administration and enforcement of their tax legislation in cross-border situations. In addition, the implementation of the mechanism provided for in the Agreement will allow for faster disclosure of illegal tax evasion activities and the proper implementation of prevention measures.

name: Margot PARKER
text: in writing. ‒ Treaties and agreements entered into by the EU could just as easily be entered into by Member States directly. UKIP opposes the authority of the EU to act in its own legal capacity in this fashion; accordingly UKIP voted against.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 The agreement signed on 12 February 2016 between the EU and Andorra to combat tax evasion and fraud marks a considerable step forward from what had already been arranged. To this end, the automatic exchange of information on the financial accounts held in their respective territories makes it possible to correctly identify the subjects, avoiding further investigation. I welcome the strengthening of discipline and I am voting in favour.

name: Alojz PETERLE
text: Writing. On 27 February 2016, the European Union and Andorra signed an agreement on the automatic exchange of financial account information with the aim of improving international cooperation in the field of taxation and compliance. I support the proposal because the agreement is an important step in the context of ongoing efforts to combat tax fraud and tax evasion and builds on the 2004 agreement that has made Andorra implement measures equivalent to those of the EU Directive on taxation of savings income. I particularly support the provision under the new agreement that eu Member States and Andorra will automatically exchange information on financial accounts held by residents of one or the other in the territory of another. The purpose is to take action in cases where the taxpayer tries to conceal capital in the form of income or property for which it has not paid tax. The purpose of the agreement is thus to ensure that Andorra implements enhanced measures equivalent to those of the EU legal framework and to respect procedures for the automatic exchange of financial account information, as promoted by OECD global standards. Andorra will also benefit, as it has recently overhauled its internal tax system and introduced personal income taxation for its residents.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: Written. I support this agreement because transparency in the tax system and banking operations is in the interest of member states. The EU has improved its agreement with Andorra, in line with international developments, to ensure that tax measures, equivalent to those in the European Union, are applied there as well. Andorra has been out of the reach of European and international tax authorities for years, but things are changing greatly and that country's tax system is increasingly being aligned with international tax acts. It is important that andorra's tax policy is open and transparent so that the relevant institutions can trace tax evasion, which is very important for this recessionary time.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: In writing. The aim is to validate the agreement signed on 12 February 2016 between the EU and Andorra on the automatic exchange of information relating to financial accounts, aimed at increasing tax cooperation and compliance with international tax obligations. The text provides that the European Union and Andorra will automatically exchange information on the accounts of their respective residents from 1 January 2017. The aim is always to deal with "ordinary" tax evasion, i.e. the concealment of income or assets in order to avoid their taxation. In accordance with OECD standards, the agreement provides that the information exchanged relates not only to savings income (interest and dividends), but also to account balances and proceeds from the sale of financial assets. In the logic of my positions on the end of banking secrecy in Europe (Switzerland, Liechtenstein, San Marino), I support this text and therefore vote in favour of it.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: Written. ‒ The European Union and Andorra signed an agreement on 12 February 2016 on the automatic exchange of information on financial accounts, which should help and improve international tax cooperation. The agreement is an important step in the current measures taken to stop tax fraud.  As a result of the new agreement, the tax administration in the Member States and Andorra will be able to: correctly and unequivocally identify taxpayers, strengthen tax laws in cross-border situations, assess the risk of tax avoidance, avoid unnecessary investigations. For all of the above, I welcome and support this agreement and its entry into force on 1 January 2017.

name: João PIMENTA LOPES
text: in writing. \u2012 This is an agreement which follows other, identical, previously signed and which we have also voted in favour of. This agreement on the automatic exchange of account and financial interest information aims, inter change, to improve international tax cooperation, and represents an important step in ongoing efforts to combat tax fraud and tax evasion.  Under the new agreement, Andorra and the EU will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts of each person's residents. The aim is to address situations where a taxpayer seeks to hide his sources of untaxed financial income. The agreement aims to ensure that Andorra applies measures that are equivalent to the legal framework of the European Union and the OECD. Although limited, we recognise the positive aspects that may result from this.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. – I support the report of my colleague Miguel Viegas. I agree with the Commission's proposal to adopt, in addition to the Austerity Agreement of 3 June 2003 concluded with Andorra, an Amendment Protocol that would introduce automatic exchange of information and ensure greater tax transparency and flow of information between the European Union and Andorra. The European Union as a whole faces a major problem of tax fraud and tax evasion, and this information-sharing system makes it easier for tax control to identify the actual beneficiaries of savings interest, which they receive in a country other than the country of dwelling. In order to prevent tax malfeasance at international level, it is necessary to establish an automatic exchange of information on which to base the OECD global standard.

name: Pavel POC
text: Writing. \u2012 I was pleased to vote in favour of the agreement with Andorra on the automatic exchange of information on financial accounts, which should take place from 2018, with the exchange of information collected from 1 January 2017. All non-transparent activities and articles that allow multinational corporations, other entities and individuals to avoid paying taxes fairly must be uncovered. I am glad that, on the basis of the agreement concluded with Andorra, taxpayers will be able to be correctly identified, tax legislation enforced in cross-border situations and the ability to detect tax evasion can be improved. The approval of the agreement is proof that we are moving in the right direction and that even countries that until recently had official tax haven status can respond correctly to the european Union's initiatives.

name: Miroslav POCHE
text: Writing. \u2012 As a Social Democrat, I am working for greater equality and transparency in today's world, and it is this agreement with Andorra on the automatic exchange of financial account information signed by the European Union in February 2016 that should achieve greater international tax cooperation and improve tax compliance. The agreement is due to enter into force on 1 January 2017 and represents an important step in ongoing efforts to combat tax fraud and tax evasion. The aim will be to address situations where the taxpayer tries to hide capital from which no tax has been paid. Since the exchange of information will take place automatically, as a result of the new agreement, the tax authorities of the EU member states and Andorra will be able to correctly and unequivocally identify the taxpayers concerned, apply and enforce their tax legislation in cross-border situations, estimate the likelihood of tax evasion and avoid unnecessary further investigation.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Union and the Principality of Andorra, in order to ensure compliance with international tax obligations, have signed an agreement on the automatic exchange of information relating to the financial accounts of their residents. This agreement, which will officially enter into force from 2017, aims to address the situation in which a taxpayer tries to conceal capital consisting of income or assets subject to tax evasion. I voted in favour of approving this agreement because it represents a further step towards combating tax fraud and evasion at European level.

name: Tomasz Piotr PORĘBA
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 The EU and the Principality of Andorra will automatically exchange financial information on the other party's residents in accordance with the updated requirements of the Administrative Cooperation Directive (DAC2) and the 2014 OECD Global Standards. This will take place from 2017. The aim is to remedy situations in which the taxpayer attempts to conceal capital constituting income or assets from which no taxes have been paid. Similar updates have been made to the agreements with Switzerland, Liechtenstein and San Marino, and the agreement with Monaco will also be updated. Work on the report was carried out through a simplified procedure (Article 50 of the Rules of Procedure).  welcomes this update as the agreement has been adapted to current EU and OECD global standards, without applying double standards to the exchange of information. The amendments include, for example, a more detailed set of data protection rules, rules on the exchange of information on request according to the OECD model and a mechanism for rapid adoption of amendments to the OECD global standard with the agreement of the other party. The information to be exchanged relates not only to income, e.g. interest and dividends, but also to account balances and proceeds from the sale of financial assets.

name: Jiří POSPÍŠIL
text: Writing. \u2012 I welcome the step towards transparency brought about by the agreement voted on. Andorra is effectively in the middle of the EU and cooperation with it is important in many areas, including the exchange of financial account information under discussion here. I therefore support the proposal.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. I am in favour of this agreement between the European Union and the Principality of Andorra, which will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts of our respective residents. Indeed, it is beneficial that relations between the EU and Andorra are based on reciprocity and harmonization of rules and, above all, that they conform to global standards, such as the 2014 automatic exchange of financial account information promoted by the OECD.

name: Julia REID
text: in writing. ‒ Treaties and agreements entered into by the EU could just as easily be entered into by Member States directly. UKIP opposes the authority of the EU to act in its own legal capacity in this fashion; accordingly UKIP voted against.

name: Sofia RIBEIRO
text: in writing. On 12 February 2016, the European Union and the Principality of Andorra signed an agreement on the automatic exchange of information on financial accounts to improve tax cooperation and compliance with international tax obligations – important progress in combating tax fraud and tax evasion. This report, which I approve, aims to ensure that Andorra applies enhanced measures equivalent to the EU legal framework updated in December 2014. It also observes the procedures for the automatic exchange of information on financial accounts, promoted by the 2014 OECD global standards, and makes Andorra tax the personal income of its residents. The other provisions of the agreement are intended to ensure that the exchange of information covers not only income, including interest and dividends, but also account balances and the proceeds of the sale of financial assets. From now on, and by virtue of this new agreement, the tax administrations of the Member States and Andorra will be able to correctly and unequivocally identify the taxpayers concerned; enforce and enforce its tax laws in cross-border situations; assess the likelihood of tax evasion and dispense with unnecessary additional investigations.

name: Liliana RODRIGUES
text: in writing. \u2012 This is an agreement aimed at automatically exchanging information on financial accounts to combat tax fraud and evasion. It is a document that is in line with the need for greater transparency in EU tax affairs in its relations with third countries.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this Legislative Resolution by which Parliament approves the conclusion of the Protocol amending the Agreement between the European Community and the Principality of Andorra on the establishment of measures equivalent to those provided for in Council Directive 2003/48/EC on the taxation of savings income in the form of interest payments. This agreement to automatically exchange information on financial accounts improves tax cooperation and compliance with tax obligations, while take an important step in the fight against tax evasion and tax evasion. Under the new Agreement, the Member States of the Union and Andorra will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts of their respective residents from 2018 for information collected from 1 January 2017. The purpose of the Agreement is to resolve situations in which a taxpayer attempts to conceal an estate representing income or assets over which no taxes have been paid.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: In writing. We approved today, in a plenary session in Strasbourg, an EU-Andorra agreement, according to which European citizens will be able to hide from the treasury to the tax administration on bank accounts in the Principality. According to the text of the agreement, the EU and Andorra will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts of their respective residents, starting in 2018 for information collected since 1 January 2017.

name: Bronis ROPĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I welcome this agreement with Andorra as an important step in the fight against tax fraud and tax evasion. The agreement is not new, but is essentially a revision of a similar document in 2004, which will ensure that Andorra applies measures equivalent to those of the EU Savings Tax Directive.  The new EU-Andorra Agreement provides for an automatic exchange of information on financial accounts held by EU and Andorra residents from 1 January 2017. This will avoid attempts by taxpayers to conceal capital consisting of income or assets for which no taxes have been paid.

name: Tokia SAÏFI
text: In writing. I supported this text, which endorses the conclusion of the protocol for amending the agreement between the European Community and the Principality of Andorra on the taxation of savings income in the form of interest payments. The European Union and Andorra signed an agreement on 12 February on the automatic exchange of financial account information, aimed at increasing tax cooperation and compliance with international tax obligations. Following the conclusion of this new agreement, the tax administrations of the EU Member States and Andorra will now be able to correctly and unequivocally identify the taxpayers concerned, enforce and enforce their tax laws in cross-border situations, assess the likelihood of tax evasion and avoid unnecessary further investigations.  The agreement is expected to enter into force on 1 January 2017.

name: Massimiliano SALINI
text: in writing. \u2012 The work of the European institutions continues to promote transparency, coordination and cooperation of tax systems between Member States and small "tax havens" within the Territory of the European Union. Little by little, despite a thousand obstacles, the project of fairer and more transparent taxation is heading in the right direction, also thanks to the OECD guidelines.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report, which establishes an agreement between the Union and Andorra establishing a framework for cooperation for the exchange of convergent tax information with which it already operates between Member States. This agreement relates only to interest taxes received by savers as creditors. The agreement moves forward to combat tax avoidance and tax evasion and facilitate transparency.

name: Christel SCHALDEMOSE
text: Written. It is important that we have more transparency when it comes to tax cooperation between the EU and third countries. The agreement with Andorra brings us one step closer to combating tax fraud and tax evasion and instead improving international tax cooperation. That is why I support the agreement.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this report because it presents a tax cooperation agreement between Andorra and the EU which improves this legislative framework and extends the exchange of tax information. While the exchange of information cannot be the only axis of action in tax matters at EU level and we consider the full abolition of such tax havens necessary, the agreement voted here unquestionably improves the current functioning of the exchange of information with Andorra, clarifying responsibilities in the sheer tax evasion that takes place through this tax haven. Despite its manifest inadequacy, the formalisation of such agreements is necessary to know the real dimension of fraud and tax evasion of European taxpayers in such jurisdictions. That's why I've decided to vote for it.

name: Remo SERNAGIOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 The EU and the Principality of Andorra will carry out an automatic exchange of tax information to improve cooperation and compliance with tax obligations at international level. I have decided to support the conclusion of the agreement as it represents an important step forward in the ongoing efforts to combat tax fraud and evasion.  From 2017, the EU and the Principality of Andorra will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts of their residents, with the aim of addressing situations in which a taxpayer tries to conceal capital consisting of income or assets subject to tax evasion. The agreement, which is in line with OECD global standards, also ensures that the information exchanged will cover not only income such as interest and dividends, but also account balances and income from financial assets.

name: Siôn SIMON
text: in writing. ‒ This agreement is in line with the manifest need for greater transparency on matters relating to tax. I voted in favour of approving the agreement because I believe that it is vital that the EU and Andorra cooperate in the worldwide fight against aggressive tax planning and tax evasion. Working with countries like Andorra will make sure that no one can dodge taxes by ‘hiding’ their money overseas.

name: Branislav ŠKRIPEK
text: in writing ‒ I voted in favour of adopting this resolution when voting on the EU-Principality Agreement on taxation of savings income in the form of interest payments. The agreement aims to ensure that Andorra applies stricter measures equivalent to the EU legal framework. The agreement therefore represents an important step in the ongoing efforts to reduce tax fraud and tax evasion.

name: Davor ŠKRLEC
text: Written. ‒ I voted positively for this report, but this explanation of the vote is a criticism of the existing system of evaluation of the work of MEMBERS of the European Parliament solely on the basis of the statistical number of parliamentary activities potentiated in Croatia, which does not really reflect the actual quality and quantity of work, efficiency and most of all the success of parliamentary action.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: in writing ‒ I could support the Agreement on the automatic exchange of financial account information between the EU and Andorra, as this is an important step in the ongoing efforts to reduce tax fraud and tax evasion. The aim of this agreement is to improve international cooperation and compliance with tax rules, which should ultimately benefit EU citizens.  The cooperation with Andorra, which we approved in the EP, foresees that EU Member States will be able to exchange information with Andorra on the financial accounts of the other party's population from 2018. The purpose of this exchange of information is to address situations where the taxpayer seeks to hide his acquired capital in the form of income or assets for which no tax has been paid. This should ensure that Andorra applies stricter measures equivalent to those applied within the scope of the EU legal framework. Under this Agreement, the procedures for the automatic exchange of financial account information in line with OECD global standards will finally apply. The provisions will thus ensure that the exchange of information concerns not only income such as interest and dividends, but also the status of accounts and proceeds from the sale of financial assets. I believe that ratification of the agreement will take place as soon as possible so that these necessary measures can be implemented.

name: Igor ŠOLTES
text: Writing. On 27 February 2016, the European Union and Andorra signed an agreement on the automatic exchange of financial account information in order to improve international cooperation in the field of taxation and compliance. The recent agreement builds on the previous one in 2004, which provided that Andorra implements measures equivalent to those of the EU Directive on taxation of savings income. Under the new agreement, the automatic exchange of financial account data between EU Member States and Andorra will take place starting from 2018 for data collected from 1 January 2017. The aim, however, is to resolve situations where the taxpayer tries to conceal capital in the form of income or property for which it has not paid tax. Tax administrations in the Member States and Andorra will be able to manage and enforce national tax legislation in cross-border situations, correctly and unambiguously determine the relevant taxpayers and assess the likelihood of tax evasion. They will also make sure that no further investigations are carried out. The agreement represents an important step in the ongoing efforts to combat tax fraud and tax evasion and strengthens cooperation in the exchange of information on financial accounts. As a result of this, I supported the report in plenary.

name: Renato SORU
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the EU-Andorra agreement on the automatic exchange of financial information for tax purposes, which aims to improve cooperation and compliance with tax obligations at international level. The agreement ensures that Andorra applies measures equivalent to those contained in the EU Directive on the taxation of savings income, in accordance with OECD procedures for the automatic exchange of financial account information. Under the new agreement, from 2018 and for information collected from 1 January 2017, EU Member States and Andorra will automatically exchange information on financial accounts held on their territories by their residents, to address situations where a taxpayer seeks to hide capital consisting of income or assets subject to tax evasion. I would like to stress that the agreement approved today is part of the broader context of cooperation between the EU and certain third countries on taxation, in line with the OECD - G20 guidelines, an area in which Parliament is constantly working for greater transparency and fairness.

name: Ivan ŠTEFANEC
text: In writing ‒ the Agreement between the European Community and the Principality of Andorra represents an important step in reducing tax fraud and tax evasion. It will allow Member States and Andora to exchange relevant information, thereby improving international cooperation and compliance with tax legislation.
