The Union has been making efforts to regulate tax issues with Andorra for a long time, and the new agreement will ensure that stricter measures equivalent to those contained in Union legal acts are applied.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. ‒ The European Union and Andorra signed a memorandum of understanding on 12 February 2016. An agreement on the automatic exchange of information on financial accounts in order to improve international tax cooperation and the performance of tax obligations at international level. This agreement is an important step in ongoing efforts to fight tax fraud and tax evasion and is an upgrade of the 2004 agreement, which ensures that Andorra applies measures equivalent to those of the EU Savings Taxation Directive. Under the new agreement, Member States of the European Union and Andorra will automatically exchange information on financial accounts held on their territory by citizens of the country representing the other party to the agreement, starting in 2018 for information collected from 1 January 2017. The aim is to tackle situations where taxpayers want to conceal capital representing income or assets for which no tax has been paid, and I have therefore supported the report.

name: Catherine STIHLER
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of approving the Agreement between the EU and Andorra because it is vital, in the global fight against aggressive tax planning and tax evasion, that we work with countries like Andorra in order to make sure that no one can dodge taxes simply by hiding their money overseas.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. In order to enhance international cooperation and coherence, the European Union and the Principality of Andorra signed the Agreement on automatic exchange of financial account information on 12 February 2016. The treaty is an important step in the fight against tax fraud and tax avoidance. It complements a 2004 treaty that brought Andorra's measures of taxation of savings gains in line with European Union measures. This agreement will also help Andorra, which recently introduced changes to its tax system such as taxing the personal income of principality citizens. The aim of this Agreement is to enable the resolution of situations of violations of laws in which the taxpayer seeks to hide capital, income or property on which he has not paid taxes in another country.  I support this Treaty because it represents a major breakthrough in the fight against tax fraud by enabling the immediate exchange of account data that EU citizens have in Andorra and vice versa. The contract will allow for the proper and unequivocal identification of taxpayers, the assessment of the likelihood of tax evasion and the enforcement of tax laws in cross-border situations.

name: Neoklis SYLIKIOTIS
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 As part of our positions in favour of tax transparency we voted in favour of the report. Moreover, its positive elements were that now the tax services of each side will be able to identify more easily the taxpayers they are talking about, they will be able to more easily apply their tax laws in cross-border cases, to combat tax avoidance more effectively and finally to coordinate their investigations in cases of tax avoidance.

name: Tibor SZANYI
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report between the European Community and the Principality of Andorra on the taxation of savings interest income. In any case, the report is to be welcomed and supported as it endorses the update of the 2004 AGREEMENT between the EU and Andorra, with which the UNION will take further serious steps in the fight against tax fraud and evasion. Under the new agreement, Andorra will now apply measures equivalent to the latest EU directive on the taxation of savings interest income and an automatic exchange of information between the two parties on financial accounts from 2018. This makes it possible to avoid taxable persons hiding capital embodying income or property for which the tax has not yet been paid. This objective is also in line with the aspirations of the EP TAX2 Special Committee. The agreement benefits both parties, helps to curb tax evasion and ultimately serves the interests of all decent taxpayers, in particular individuals and SMEs.

name: Claudia ȚAPARDEL
text: in writing. – The European Union has recently started an extensive process to combat tax evasion and tax fraud. In this respect, the EU has concluded a number of agreements with third countries regarding cooperation for the exchange of information on bank accounts. One of these states is Andorra, with which the EU signed such an agreement on 12 February 2016, which made improvements to the old agreement signed in 2004 and which concerned only the taxation of deposit income.  The exchange of information will be extended, from 2017, to the accounts of the residents of the two parties, in order to avoid hiding capital for which the corresponding fees have not been paid by taxpayers.  Andorra's application of these measures will be tantamount to the application of European legislation in this area, in line with OECD global standards. In these circumstances, I support the adoption of the current document as an important step in solving this problem.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: In writing. I said yes to this text, which provides that the Member States of the European Union and Andorra will automatically exchange, from 2018, the information on the financial accounts of their respective residents collected since 1 January 2017. The objective is to deal with situations in which a taxpayer seeks to conceal capital that corresponds to income or assets over which the tax has not been paid. The agreement aims to ensure that Andorra implements enhanced measures equivalent to those provided for in the EU's legal framework, updated in December 2014 (modifying the Administrative Cooperation Directive, "DCA2"), and that it complies with the automatic exchange of financial account information recommended by the 2014 OECD Global Standard. It will also benefit Andorra, which recently reformed its tax system by introducing personal income tax on its residents.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the amendment of the agreement that will tighten Andorra’s lenient tax laws. Under this new agreement, EU Member States and Andorra will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts held on their territories by each other’s residents as of 2018. This is an important tool to address situations where a taxpayer seeks to hide capital representing income or assets for which taxes have not been paid, especially in cross-border situations.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for an agreement between the European Community and the Principality of Andorra to tax interest income on savings, as I believe it represents an upgrade of the 2004 agreement and is an important step in combating fraud and tax evasion. This agreement will ensure enhanced measures by Andorra that are equivalent to the legal framework of the European Union and are in line with the procedures for automatic exchange of information on financial accounts recommended under the Global Standard of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development of 2014. I believe this agreement will address situations in which taxpayers seek to conceal capital representing income or assets for which no tax has been paid. I also believe that it will be accurately and unequivocally established which taxpayers are in question, assess the likelihood of tax evasion and avoid unnecessary further investigations.

name: Romana TOMC
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the report on the proposal for a Council decision on the conclusion, on behalf of the European Union, of the Amending Protocol to the Agreement between the European Community and the Principality of Andorra on measures equivalent to those laid down in Council Directive 2003/48/EC on taxation of savings income in the form of interest payments, as this is an encouraging step in the area of ongoing efforts to prevent tax fraud and tax evasion. This Decision represents a meaningful upgrade of the 2004 agreement and brings new developments aimed at ensuring that Andorra implements enhanced measures equivalent to those of the EU legal framework, while respecting procedures for the automatic exchange of financial account information. It is the latter that also promotes the 2014 OECD World Standards.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report, which establishes an agreement between the Union and Andorra establishing a framework for cooperation for the exchange of convergent tax information with which it already operates between Member States. This agreement relates only to interest taxes received by savers as creditors. The agreement moves forward to combat tax avoidance and tax evasion and facilitate transparency.

name: Ramon TREMOSA i BALCELLS
text: in writing. ‒ I agree with this proposal to strengthen relations of the European Union with Andorra in order to improve transparency in the exchange of banking and financial information and to prevent tax fraud in border areas.

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: In writing. The aim here is to validate the agreement signed on 12 February 2016 between the EU and Andorra on the automatic exchange of information relating to financial accounts, aimed at increasing tax cooperation and compliance with tax obligations at international level. In the logic of the ENL Group's positions on the end of banking secrecy in Europe, I voted for this text.

name: István UJHELYI
text: Writing. \u2012 On 12 February 2016, the European Union and Andorra signed an agreement on the automatic exchange of financial account information aimed at improving international tax cooperation and compliance. The agreement ensures that Andorra applies measures equivalent to the EU Directive on the taxation of interest income from savings. Under the new agreement, an automatic exchange of information between EU Member States and Andorra on data collected from 1 January 2017 will be established for the financial accounts of citizens of another country in the territory of one country from 2018 onwards. The aim is to address situations where taxable persons seek to conceal capital conbodied in the sense of income or property for which the tax has not yet been paid. I voted in favour.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: in writing. We voted in favour of this report, which establishes an agreement between the Union and Andorra establishing a framework for cooperation for the exchange of convergent tax information with which it already operates between Member States. This agreement relates only to interest taxes received by savers as creditors. The agreement moves forward to combat tax avoidance and tax evasion and facilitate transparency.

name: Ernest URTASUN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of this agreement between the European Union and Andorra as it is a step towards more cooperation on exchange of information on financial accounts of residents.

name: Ivo VAJGL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report concerning the EU-Andorra agreement on the automatic exchange of financial account information. The report entails the automatic interchange of information on the bank accounts of each other’s residents, with the aim of reducing tax fraud and tax evasion. The information to be exchanged includes income, such as interest and dividends, but also account balances and earnings from the sale of financial assets. This agreement will make it more difficult for EU citizens to hide cash from the tax authorities in bank accounts in Andorra, allowing for better financial transparency in the EU.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: in writing. After the adoption of Council Directive 2003/48/EC and to preserve the level playing field of economic operators, the EU proceeds to update this agreement under the new conditions laid down by the Directive. We are talking about a simplified procedure, which does not have any conflict because of what I consider necessary to vote in favour.

name: Elena VALENCIANO
text: in writing. I voted in favour of this international agreement with Andorra on the automatic exchange of tax information because it is a major step forward in combating tax evasion and avoidance, particularly in third States by natural or legal persons who are nationals of a Member State of the Union.  The European and Spanish Socialists are firmly committed to the definitive abolition of tax havens in the world, and particularly within or on the margins of the European Union, as they erode the financing of the welfare state and, ultimately, social justice.

name: Hilde VAUTMANS
text: Written. 'I support this agreement which aims to strengthen cooperation between the European Union and Andorra in order to increase transparency in the exchange of financial and banking data and to prevent tax fraud in the border regions.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. The agreement signed this year on the automatic exchange of information on financial accounts to improve international tax cooperation represents an important step in ongoing efforts to combat tax fraud and tax evasion. With the new agreement, Member States and Andorra will automatically exchange information on financial accounts held on their territory by residents of each country, starting in 2018 for information collected from 1 January 2017. The goal is to address situations where a taxpayer seeks to hide income-generating capital or assets for which taxes have not been paid. The agreement aims to ensure that Andorra implements the recently strengthened measures in the EU legal framework in December 2014 (amending the Administrative Cooperation Directive, "DAC 2") and in line with OECD 2014 standards for automatic exchange of information.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. The agreement is an important step in efforts to combat tax fraud and tax evasion. It updates the 2004 agreement, which ensured that Andorra applies rules equivalent to those in an EU directive on the taxation of savings. We must therefore vote in favour of this report.

name: Beatrix von STORCH
text: Writing. I am committed to the restoration of banking and tax secrecy. The intergovernmental exchange of tax data on interest income contradicts both concerns. Tax evasion must be combated in other ways. In particular, I am opposed to putting citizens under general suspicion and, without any concrete indication, of undermining any data protection.

name: Julie WARD
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of approving the agreement between the EU and Andorra because it is vital, in the global fight against tax avoidance and evasion, that we work with countries like Andorra in order to make sure that no one can dodge taxes simply by hiding their money overseas. With trillions of dollars in tax evasion and avoidance sent to tax havens around the world, the fight for tax justice is one of the most important avenues for a more equal, equitable and a more democratic world. The EU is one of the only global actors able to tackle the problem, something which Member States could not do on their own.

name: Iuliu WINKLER
text: in writing. – I voted on the report on the EC-Andorra Agreement on taxation of savings income in the form of interest payments. Earlier this year, the EU and Andorra signed an agreement on the automatic exchange of information on financial accounts, with the aim of improving tax cooperation and compliance with tax rules at international level. This agreement is an important step in the current efforts to combat tax fraud and evasion and updates the 2004 agreement ensuring that Andorra applies measures equivalent to those of the EU Savings Income Tax Directive.

name: Theodoros ZAGORAKIS
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 This report, which I voted for, strengthens international tax cooperation, strengthens tax mechanisms and revenue control and is generally an additional mechanism for combating tax evasion. The agreement will enter into force on 1 January 2017, as decided between the EU and Andorra.

name: Marco ZANNI
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Union and the Principality of Andorra have signed an agreement on the automatic exchange of financial information for tax purposes aimed at improving cooperation and compliance with tax obligations at international level. This is the fourth in a package of five agreements, covering Switzerland, Liechtenstein, San Marino, Andorra and Monaco. Although these agreements improve on the status quo, they are still a long way from resolving most of the existing problems with all these countries in practice.  On the basis of this agreement, the EU and the Principality of Andorra will automatically exchange information on the financial accounts of their residents, in order to increase efforts to combat fraud, avoidance and tax evasion, which see the Principality as one of the most sensitive countries in these respects. I find this text unsatisfactory because we could and should have looked for a more complete and in-depth agreement without leaving any regulatory gaps that could easily be circumvented. For all these reasons, I have chosen to abstain.

name: Jana ŽITŇANSKÁ
text: in writing ‒ I supported the Agreement on automated exchange of information between the European Union and the Principality of Andorra. This is already the fourth agreement of this kind concluded by the European Union in a short time, and, like the agreements with Switzerland, Liechtenstein and San Marino, this agreement is aimed at exchanging information on resident financial accounts in order to combat tax avoidance. In addition to this objective, as in previous cases, the Agreement is aimed at updating the standards applied in line with OECD requirements, which will effectively prevent situations that might occur with the application of double standards. I therefore gave my voice to the report.

name: Milan ZVER
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the Report on the proposal for a Council decision on the conclusion, on behalf of the European Union, of the Amending Protocol to the Agreement between the European Community and the Principality of Andorra on measures equivalent to those laid down in Council Directive 2003/48/EC on taxation of savings income in the form of interest payments establishing an unconditional exchange of information on financial accounts.  I believe that the agreement will intensify the ongoing efforts to combat tax fraud and tax evasion and ensure that Andorra respects the procedures for the automatic exchange of financial account information.

name: Isabella ADINOLFI
text: in writing. \u2012 The appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA (European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority) was proposed by the Board of Supervisors and, following his hearing, the appointment was approved by the ECON Committee.  EIOPA's tasks are to ensure the stability of the financial system, the transparency of markets and financial products and the protection of contractors. Unfortunately, in our opinion, there are many doubts as to the usefulness of EIOPA for European citizens and its effective ability to protect the reference markets. For these reasons, I have chosen to abstain.

name: Marina ALBIOL GUZMÁN
text: in writing. The parliamentary oversight of the activity of the European Insurance and Pensions Authority (ESPJ) is insufficient, so I have decided to abstain in this designation.

name: Martina ANDERSON
text: in writing. – We voted against the Appointment of a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) as we have grave concerns with the EIOPA. A number of these regulatory bodies were set up after the financial crash, the stated aim being to regulate the financial markets so that another financial crash wouldn’t happen. Of course, robust regulation is required but there are critical concerns with these bodies. There is a huge democratic deficit running through these bodies and moreover, a number of legal concerns have been voiced. The bodies have very fragile legal foundations and a number of legal experts have stated that the setting up of such bodies was done outside of the confines of EU Treaty law.  To explain simply, when an EU body is being set up, you have to first go back to the primary treaties which founded the EU and look at the Treaty provisions. If there is no provision in the Treaty to set up such an initiative, then it can be declared as ultra vires i.e. being outside of EU law and having no legal foundation. Therefore, it was for these reasons that we voted against the appointment of a Director as it would inadvertently endorse an undemocratic body.

name: Nikos ANDROULAKIS
text: S&D), in writing. \u2012 This report mentions the proposal to appoint a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA). More specifically, in the report, taking into account that the term of office of the current Executive Director expires on 31 March 2016 and that the IORA Board of Supervisors proposed the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente, who subsequently answered questions from the members of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs at its hearing, his appointment is approved. I voted in favour of this proposal for a decision and we await the outcome of the consultations with the Commission, the Council and the national governments.

name: Marie-Christine ARNAUTU
text: In writing. Mr Fausto Parente is appointed by this report to the executive directorate of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term. As this person was not seriously introduced to us, I abstained.

name: Jonathan ARNOTT
text: in writing. ‒ This vote was carried out by secret ballot. In the interest of transparency I would like my constituents to know I voted against this appointment. I do not believe secret ballots should be held in any Parliament in the interests of being transparent with the public we serve. I want my constituents to know that I voted against appointing more fat-cats to the Commission.

name: Zigmantas BALČYTIS
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the appointment of Faust Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA.

name: Nicolas BAY
text: In writing. The report endorses the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term.  The President remains Mr. Gabriel Bernardino. In the absence of evidence to support or disadvantage the candidate, I abstained.

name: Hugues BAYET
text: In writing. I voted to appoint Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term.

name: Beatriz BECERRA BASTERRECHEA
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the Commission's proposal to appoint As Executive Director of EESPJ (European Insurance and Retirement Pensions Authority) the Italian Fausto Parente.  Fausto Parente is the current head of Supervision and Policy Directorate of the Italian Insurance Institute (IVASS - Istituto di Vigilanza sulle Assicurazioni). Its appointment has taken place following an open selection procedure in order to fill this position which would become vacant on 31 March at the end of the current term of office. I wish Mr Parente success in the performance of his new work which must meet in the coming years the challenge of advancing the regulation of supervision in the European insurance sector.

name: Brando BENIFEI
text: in writing. \u2012 EIOPA is the European insurance and occupational pensions authority. It is a body set up in 2010 which has as its main objectives to improve consumer protection, restore confidence in the financial system and promote wider harmonisation and enforcement of the rules for financial institutions and markets within the EU.  The term of office of the current Executive Director of EIOPA, Carlos Montalvo, will end on 31 March 2016 but as early as 28 January 2016 the board of the supervisory authorities of the institution, at the end of an open selection procedure, proposed to appoint Fausto Parente as Executive Director with a five-year term. On 23 February 2016, the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing with Fausto Parente, listening to his statements and the answers given to the questions put to him by the members of the committee. The committee gave a favourable opinion and brought the matter to Parliament's attention. The Gualtieri report, which I supported, accepts the committee's proposal and establishes the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA.

name: Xabier BENITO ZILUAGA
text: in writing. U2012 We abstained in the appointment of this position, as we do not share the general line with which EESPJ functional nor the mandate given to Fausto Parente.

name: Dominique BILDE
text: In writing. This report, which endorses the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term, keeping Mr Gabriel Bernardino as President, does not provide any evidence for or against the candidate, nor any clarification. I therefore decide to abstain on this vote.

name: Mara BIZZOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 I do not question the professional skills of this candidate, but having to hold the role of Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA), he will have to apply rules recently approved by the EP on which I strongly expressed my opposition; That is why I have chosen to abstain in the vote.

name: José BLANCO LÓPEZ
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the appointment of Fausto Parente as executive director of the European Insurance and Pensions Authority, given that the mandate of the current Executive Director ends on 31 March and that on 28 January the EESPJ Board of Supervisors, following an open selection procedure, proposed to appoint Fausto Parente to office for a five-year term , and that on 23 February the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing with Fausto Parente.

name: Vilija BLINKEVIČIŪTĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted on this report on the proposal to appoint the Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA). The appointment of a new Director is necessary as the term of office of the current Executive Director of EIOPA expires on 31 March 2016. February 23, 2016 The Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing with Faust Parente, during which he gave an introductory speech and answered questions put by committee members. The European Parliament approves the appointment of Faust Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA.

name: Franc BOGOVIČ
text: Writing. \ u2012 I had no reservations in supporting the decision to appoint a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) by Mr Fausto Parente. Mr Parente has already proven himself to be a trusted person through his past work, so I think it is appropriate to be given a five-year term at the helm of EIOPA.

name: Steeve BRIOIS
text: In writing. This report aims to confirm the appointment of Mr Fausto as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term. Without any evidence for or against the candidate, I have decided to abstain on this vote.

name: Daniel BUDA
text: in writing. \u2012 Union organisations are the engine of its actions and their division into structures and areas ensures better coherence and coverage of citizens' needs. The European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority supports insurance undertakings and contributes to a financial supervision system with other institutions. Following a selection procedure opened on 28 January 2016, the EIOPA Board of Supervisors proposed the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term in accordance with Article 51(2) and (3) of Regulation (EU) No 1782/2003. 1094/2010 and, on 23 February 2016, the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing with Fausto Parente, during which he made an introductory statement and then answered the questions put by the members of the committee, following the procedures for those situations.  Knowing that these authorities are independent and act only in the interest of the Union as a whole, I voted in favour of the opinion on the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA.

name: Gianluca BUONANNO
text: in writing. \u2012 Abstention vote against the candidacy of Mr Fausto Parente. Professional qualities are not discussed, but it is a subject who will, in fact, be called upon to apply some of the rules recently approved by the European Parliament and against which we have taken a heavy stand.  Think of the Balz report that was recently adopted.

name: Nicola CAPUTO
text: in writing. \u2012 After careful reflection and discussion in this House, I voted in favour of the report on the proposal to appoint the Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) on the basis of the following considerations: - the mandate of the current Executive Director of EIOPA will end on 31 March 2016; - the Board of Supervisors of EIOPA has proposed the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term, in accordance with Article 51(2) and (3) of Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010; - the selection took place under an open procedure, in compliance with the public evidence, and at the end of the selection the hearing of Fausto Parente was held, during which he made a preliminary statement and answered the questions put to him by the members of the committee. For these reasons, I voted in favour of the post.

name: Matt CARTHY
text: in writing. ‒ I voted against the Appointment of a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) as I have grave concerns with the EIOPA.  A number of these regulatory bodies were set up after the financial crash, the stated aim being to regulate the financial markets so that another financial crash wouldn’t happen. Of course, robust regulation is required but there are critical concerns with these bodies. There is a huge democratic deficit running through these bodies and moreover, a number of legal concerns have been voiced. The bodies have very fragile legal foundations and a number of legal experts have stated that the setting up of such bodies was done outside of the confines of EU Treaty law.  To explain simply, when an EU body is being set up, you have to first go back to the primary treaties which founded the EU and look at the Treaty provisions. If there is no provision in the Treaty to set up such an initiative, then it can be declared as ultra vires i.e. being outside of EU law and having no legal foundation. Therefore, it was for these reasons that I voted against the appointment of a Director as it would inadvertently endorse an undemocratic body.

name: David CASA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) because of his relevant experience and the high level of managerial and leadership skills. He was very convincing at the hearing of the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs in February and it is certain that EIOPA will continue to function well under his direction.

name: Fabio Massimo CASTALDO
text: in writing. \u2012 The term of office of the current Executive Director of EIOPA will end on 31 March 2016; On 28 January 2016, the Board of Supervisors of EIOPA, following an open selection procedure, proposed to appoint Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term, following the hearing at the relevant committee. There are no negative comments on the proposed application, but doubts remain as to the actual necessity of the Authority in question and its operation. For this reason, I have chosen to abstain.

name: Lefteris CHRISTOFOROU
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 We support the report approving the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA.

name: Alberto CIRIO
text: in writing. \u2012 With regard to the appointment proposed by the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs (ECON) of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA), I voted in favour because I personally believe he is a brilliant person and also has an exceptional international curriculum in the field of regulation and supervisory policies. I would like to take advantage of this statement to wish him well in his work.

name: Deirdre CLUNE
text: in writing. ‒ The European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) was established in consequence of the reforms to the structure of supervision of the financial sector in the European Union. The reform was initiated by the Commission, following the recommendations of a Committee of Wise Men, chaired by Mr de Larosière, and supported by the European Council and Parliament. Before and during the financial crisis in 2007 and 2008, the European Parliament called for a move towards more integrated European supervision in order to ensure a true level playing field for all actors at the level of the European Union and to reflect the increasing integration of financial markets in the Union. As a result, the supervisory framework was strengthened to reduce the risk and severity of future financial crises. EIOPA is part of a European System of Financial Supervisors that comprises three European Supervisory Authorities, one for the banking sector, one for the securities sector and one for the insurance and occupational pensions sector, as well as the European Systemic Risk Board.

name: Lara COMI
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the appointment of Dr Fausto Parente as the new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority. The new director has a respected curriculum in the area of regulation and supervisory policies. Therefore, my warmest congratulations and good wishes for a good job go to him.

name: Therese COMODINI CACHIA
text: in writing. ‒ EIOPA’s core responsibilities are to support the stability of the financial system, the transparency of markets and financial products as well as the protection of policyholders, pension scheme members and beneficiaries. I take on board the final decision of the Board of Supervisors of the EIOPA, following an open selection procedure, which proposed to appoint Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a term of office of five years.

name: Ignazio CORRAO
text: in writing. \u2012 The term of office of the current Executive Director of EIOPA will end on 31 March 2016. On 28 January 2016, the Board of Supervisors of EIOPA, following an open selection procedure, proposed the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term. On 23 February 2016, the ECON Committee held a hearing of Fausto Parente, during which he made a preliminary statement and answered questions put to him by the members of the committee. The ECON Committee subsequently approved the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA. There are no particular issues to be raised about the candidate, but there are still many doubts as to the usefulness of this authority and its actual functioning. For these reasons, I have chosen to abstain during the vote in plenary.

name: Javier COUSO PERMUY
text: in writing. The parliamentary oversight of the activity of the European Insurance and Pensions Authority (ESPJ) is insufficient, so I have decided to abstain in this designation.

name: Andrea COZZOLINO
text: in writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the European Parliament resolution appointing the Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority because I believe that the candidate chosen Fausto Parente has the right skills, both managerial and leadership skills and professional experience at national and international level to play this role.

name: Andi CRISTEA
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority has a major role to play in preventing crises by maintaining financial stability, monitoring and assessing potential risks and vulnerabilities that may arise in various cross-border activities and areas of competence. In a society where the ratio of the working and passive populations is in a heightened situation of imbalance, the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority monitors these changes in order to ensure the protection of policyholders. Since the tasks of this authority require a person who has demonstrated his professionalism in the functions he has held in the past, I strongly support the appointment of Fausto Perente as Executive Director of EIOPA.

name: Pál CSÁKY
text: Writing. \u2012 The current executive's term of office expires at the end of March, which is why we had to choose a new person. Only one nomination was received for the candidates, Fausto Parente, who was appointed for a five-year term.

name: Edward CZESAK
text: I would like to write to the Commission. \u2012 In February 2016, the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing of Italian candidate Fausto Parente. The ECR Group supported his candidature as the candidate has demonstrated the appropriate competence and has extensive experience working for the competent national authority (IVASS – Italian insurance supervisory authority). You have been involved in EIOPA since the creation of the European Office and therefore have extensive knowledge of its functioning and thematic areas currently on the agenda. In view of Mr Parente's experience, I voted in favour.

name: Miriam DALLI
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the appointment of a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term as the term of office of EIOPA’s current Executive Director ends on 31 March 2016 and a new one must be appointed. Therefore, the Board of Supervisors of the EIOPA has proposed that Fausto Parente be appointed as the following Executive Director for a subsequent five years in office. This proposal resulted from an open selection procedure, and the nominee was also previously backed by Parliament’s own Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs, which held a hearing with Mr Parente at which he was extensively questioned by members of the Committee.

name: Mireille D'ORNANO
text: In writing. The report endorses the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term. In the absence of decisive factual evidence in favour or against the candidate, I preferred to abstain on this vote.

name: Georgios EPITIDEIOS
text: NI), in writing. \u2012 The appointment of an Executive Director for the European Insurance and Pensions Authority is a simple procedural matter which, in fact, is irrelevant. This Insurance and Pensions Supervisory Authority has not issued a report condemning the bloody cuts to pensions and the subsidence of insurance funds in Greece by the stock market and PSI scandals.

name: José Manuel FERNANDES
text: in writing. \u2012 The Board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) has proposed the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term. The Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing of Fausto Parente, in which he delivered an initial statement, then answering questions from the members of the committee, without the Commission having raised any problems. Therefore, I agree with the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA.

name: Edouard FERRAND
text: In writing. Abstention: no evidence to support or disadvantage the candidate.

name: João FERREIRA
text: in writing. \u2012 EIOPA (European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority) is part of the European Financial Supervision System (ESFS) and aims to support the stability of the financial system and the transparency of markets and financial products. It also seeks to protect policyholders and members and beneficiaries of pension schemes. Creating the illusion that the problems that led to the 2007/2008 financial crisis are solved, the ESFS has not changed the fundamental issue of financial speculation – keeping the mechanisms that underlie and enabling it untouched – as it has not put an end to derivatives markets and tax havens and has not instituted the separation of commercial investment banking. As it is already clear and how it will tend to become even clearer in the future of the creation of these European authorities. We have been against the establishment of this system and its authorities. Our vote on the appointment of the Executive Director of the authority in question reflects this position of principle.

name: Luke Ming FLANAGAN
text: in writing. ‒ I abstained.

name: Monika BEŇOVÁ
text: in writing \ u2012 This particular case is a technical proposal, as the term of office of the current Director of EIOPA expires on 31 December 2016, and so, according to the proposal of the Supervisory Board of EIOPA, Mr Fausto Parente will be appointed for a further five-year term of office.

name: Lorenzo FONTANA
text: in writing. \u2012 I am abstaining as director EIOPA will have to apply certain rules that I am against.

name: Lampros FOUNTOULIS
text: Writing. \u2012 The appointment of an Executive Director for the European Insurance and Pensions Authority is a simple procedural matter which, in fact, is irrelevant. An Insurance and Pensions Supervisory Authority which has not issued a report condemning the bloody cuts to pensions and the subsidence of insurance funds in Greece by the stock market and PSI scandals.

name: Doru-Claudian FRUNZULICĂ
text: in writing. ‒ Taking into consideration the proposal of the Board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) of 3 February 2016 for the appointment of the Executive Director of the EIOPA for a five-year term (C8-0023/2016), I support the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a term of office of five years, in accordance with Article 51(2) and (3) of Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010.

name: Jens GIESEKE
text: Writing. I support the appointment of the new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA).

name: Neena GILL
text: in writing. ‒ I supported the nomination of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA). He has gained considerable experience in working for regulatory bodies in Italy and internationally. My hope is that he can build on the successes of EIOPA – which include the recent harmonisation of EU insurance regulation (Solvency II). We should be seeking a consistent level of regulation of financial systems across the EU, including coordinated responses to common problems. But we will not be able to help consumers in the UK should we turn our back on the EU.

name: Tania GONZÁLEZ PEÑAS
text: in writing. U2012 We abstained in the appointment of this position, as we do not share the general line with which EESPJ functional nor the mandate given to Fausto Parente.

name: Antanas GUOGA
text: in writing. ‒ I support the appointment of Fausto Parente to this position. Mr Parente has had a long and illustrious career in this field, and I think he will do an excellent job as Executive Director.

name: Takis HADJIGEORGIOU
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 We voted to abstain on the appointment of the new Executive Director of the EORA on the ground that we are opposed to the logic of an increasing concentration of powers in Brussels.

name: Ivan JAKOVČIĆ
text: Written. ‒ I voted for a proposal for a decision by the European Parliament on a proposal to appoint the Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) on the basis that Mr Fausto Parente has demonstrated that he has the necessary management and management skills, and the capacity and expertise in financial supervision and regulation. His previous national and international wealth of experience has certainly influenced the selection process, the outcome of which is the appointment of Mr Parente as chief executive for a term of five years. I also believe that approval by Parliament is important for EIOPA to continue its regular work, and I therefore support this report.

name: Jean-François JALKH
text: In writing. The report endorses the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term. The President remains Mr. Gabriel Bernardino. Without any evidence for or against the candidate, I abstained on this vote.

name: Marc JOULAUD
text: In writing. I voted in favour of my colleague Roberto Gualtieri's report on the appointment of a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (AEAPP). This text approves the application proposed by the Supervisory Authority's Board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority after a hearing by the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs. This appointment was adopted by a large majority, which I welcome.

name: Philippe JUVIN
text: In writing. This report endorses the appointment of a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (AEAPP). The AEAPP Board of Supervisors proposed, after an open selection procedure, to appoint Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term. As Mr Parente is a serious and well-known candidate, I voted in favour of this report.

name: Barbara KAPPEL
text: Writing. I am voting in favour of awarding the post to Mr Fausto Parente, as his expertise is internationally recognised and his previous professional experience qualiises him well for the position at EIOPA.

name: Stelios KOULOGLOU
text: in writing. ‒ The board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions authority, EIOPA has to appoint an Executive Director. I voted abstention on the candidate nominated by the ECON Committee since the candidate comes from a mainstream political group.

name: Giovanni LA VIA
text: in writing. This proposal concerns the appointment of the Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) for a five-year term. The term of office of the current Executive Director of EIOPA will end on 31 March 2016 and we are therefore called upon to decide. In this regard, the Board of Supervisors of EIOPA, at the end of an open selection procedure, proposed Dr Fausto Parente. I support this choice, which has been achieved through a transparent selection process. I therefore congratulate the new director Fausto Parente on having achieved this personal goal and wish him good work.

name: Gilles LEBRETON
text: In writing. I abstained on this report because it relates to the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority. But I don't know him and I don't care about his choice.

name: Philippe LOISEAU
text: In writing. This report announces the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (AEAPP) for a five-year term. However, having no evidence on this candidacy, I abstained.

name: Paloma LÓPEZ BERMEJO
text: in writing. The parliamentary oversight of the activity of the European Insurance and Pensions Authority (ESPJ) is insufficient, so I have decided to abstain in this designation.

name: Ivana MALETIĆ
text: Written. ‒ On 3 February 2016, the Supervisory Board of the European Insurance and Employment Pensions Agency (EIOPA) submitted a proposal for the appointment of an Executive Director as the term of office of the current Executive Director ends on 31 March 2016. Following a public tender, the supervisory board nominated Faust Parente as its new CEO for a period of five years. On 23 February 2016 The Economic and Monetary Policy Committee (ECON) held a hearing of Faust Parente, at which he outlined his position and answered questions from committee members. Based on the hearing, ECON made a positive decision, so I supported this report.

name: Vladimír MAŇKA
text: in writing ‒ I supported the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA for a five-year term of office. Mr Parente is a successful open selection procedure conducted by the EIOPA Supervisory Board and meets the professional and qualification requirements for the performance of this function.

name: Notis MARIAS
text: ECR), in writing. \u2012 I am voting against the report on the proposal to appoint the Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority, as I do not agree with key points in that report.

name: Dominique MARTIN
text: In writing. Dominique Martin abstained on this vote. The aim here was to endorse the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term. Without evidence for or against the candidate, we abstained.

name: Gabriel MATO
text: in writing. My support for the proposal to appoint Fausto Parente as executive director of the European Insurance and Pensions Authority.

name: Valentinas MAZURONIS
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the appointment of Faust Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA).

name: Joëlle MÉLIN
text: In writing. The induction of Mr Fausto Parente as head of the executive of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term is sealed by this report. Having no evidence to allow me to judge this candidate or not, I abstained.

name: Nuno MELO
text: in writing. \u2012 I have submitted my vote in agreement with the proposal for the appointment of the Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA).

name: David MARTIN
text: in writing. ‒ I voted to approve the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the EIOPA.

name: Miroslav MIKOLÁŠIK
text: in writing – the Supervisory Board of EIOPA has elected Faust Parente as Executive Director. The selection process assessed the managerial and leadership skills of the candidates, as well as the skills and experience acquired in the field of financial supervision and regulation. F. Parente has had a remarkable career in the sphere of supervisory and regulatory policies at national and international level. He is currently head of the Supervisory and Regulatory Directorate of the Italian Insurance Supervisory Authority, IVASS (Istituto di Vigilanza sulle Assicurazioni). The Executive Director of EIOPA shall be elected for a five-year term, with the possibility of a single re-election. Taking into account Mr Parente's persona, his competence and many years of experience in the relevant field, I express my support for him and vote in favour of his election as Executive Director of EIOPA.

name: Marlene MIZZI
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted in favour of the report because I support the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the EIOPA.

name: Csaba MOLNÁR
text: Writing. \u2012 The term of office of the current Managing Director of EIOPA expires on 31 March 2016. On 28 January 2016, following an open tender procedure, the EIOPA Board of Supervisors recommended the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term of office. On 23 February 2016, fausto parente was heard by the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs, who gave an opening statement and answered questions from the members of the committee. Against this basis, the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs proposes in its report that Parliament approve the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA. I voted accordingly.

name: Bernard MONOT
text: In writing. The report endorses the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term.  The President remains Mr. Gabriel Bernardino. Without evidence for or against the candidate, it is proposed to abstain on this vote.

name: Cláudia MONTEIRO DE AGUIAR
text: in writing. \u2012 Given that the term of office of the current Executive Director of the Board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) has its term of office on 31 March 2016, the EIOPA Board of Supervisors on 28 January 2016, following a call for tenders, proposed the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term and to which the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs hearing of Fausto Parente, on February 23, 2016, in which he delivered an initial statement, following questions from the members of the committee, I approve the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA.

name: Sophie MONTEL
text: In writing. This report confirms the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term. Unable to express myself without having any doubt about the competence and probity of the candidate, I preferred to abstain.

name: Nadine MORANO
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report, which approves the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of AEAPP to replace the current Executive Director whose term expires on 31 March 2016. Fausto Parente was heard by the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs. The members of this committee approved this nomination by a very large majority.

name: Renaud MUSELIER
text: In writing. I was not able, for medical reasons, to attend the plenary session from 7 to 10 March 2016. Nevertheless, I would like to express my support for the appointment of a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority.

name: József NAGY
text: Writing. \u2012 An important supervisory body of the European Banking Authority is the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority, which was established by a regulation issued by the European Parliament and the Council in 2010. Since then, the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority has played an important role in maintaining the stability of the European Union's financial system and internal market. The Executive Director plays a key role in the effective functioning of the Office. Since, following the open tender procedure, the independent board of EIOPA found Fausto Parente to be the most suitable for the advertised position, I, too, support his appointment as Executive Director and wish him every success in starting his next five-year term of office!

name: Victor NEGRESCU
text: in writing. ‒ I have voted for the appointment of a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA).

name: Urmas PAET
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the appointment of the Executive Director to ensure consistent management of the organisation.

name: Aldo PATRICIELLO
text: in writing. \u2012 Considering the brilliant national and international curriculum in the field of regulation and supervisory policies of Dr. Fausto Parente, current head of the Regulatory and Supervisory Policy Service at IVASS, I believe that his five-year appointment as head of EIOPA (the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority) is to be considered excellent news. I am therefore voting in favour in full.

name: Marijana PETIR
text: Written. ‒ I supported the election of Faust Parente as executive director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority with a five-year mandate.  EIOPA, as an independent advisory body of the European Parliament, the Council of the European Union and the European Commission, has its responsibility to support the stability of the financial system, market transparency and financial products, as well as to protect policyholders, members and beneficiaries of pension funds. In addition to a number of activities such as monitoring and identifying trends, potential risks and vulnerabilities arising from a microprudential level, EIOPA's main objectives are to improve consumer protection, restore trust in the financial system, ensure a high, efficient and persistent level of regulation and supervision, taking into account the different interests of all Member States and the different nature of financial institutions. In addition, the objectives are to better harmonise and consistently apply rules for financial institutions and markets across the European Union, strengthen the supervision of cross-border groups and promote a coordinated EU response to irregularities.  I wish Mr. Faust Parente much success in carrying out this responsible duty.

name: Florian PHILIPPOT
text: In writing. The report endorses the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term. The President remains Mr. Gabriel Bernardino. I disapprove of the proliferation of fussy "European authorities" encroaching on the sovereignty of States, but I have no particular hostility towards Mr Parente. So I prefer to abstain.

name: Tonino PICULA
text: Written. ‒ The Ceo of EIOPA is a full-time person in charge of the day-to-day management of EIOPA and the implementation of the annual and multiannual work programme. The term of office of the Executive Director is five years and may be extended once. As the mandate of the current Executive Director of EIOPA expires on 31 March 2016, the Board of Supervisors of EIOPA proposed, following an open selection procedure on 28 January 2016, that Fausto Parente be appointed Executive Director. Fausto Parente, in his opening statement and answers to questions from board members, highlighted his managerial and management experiences, as well as the expertise and ability related to financial oversight and regulation. Based on Mr Parente's career in supervisory regulations and policies at national and international level, I support his appointment as the new chief executive of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority.

name: João PIMENTA LOPES
text: in writing. \u2012 EIOPA (European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority) is part of the European Financial Supervision System (ESFS) and aims to support the stability of the financial system and the transparency of markets and financial products. It also seeks to protect policyholders and members and beneficiaries of pension schemes. Creating the illusion that the problems that led to the 2007/2008 financial crisis are solved, the ESFS has not changed the fundamental issue of financial speculation – keeping the mechanisms that underlie and enabling it untouched – as it has not put an end to derivatives markets and tax havens and has not instituted the separation of commercial investment banking. As is already clear and how it will tend to become even clearer in the future, the creation of these European authorities was of little value. We have been against the establishment of this system and its authorities. Our vote on the appointment of the Executive Director of the authority in question reflects this position of principle.

name: Andrej PLENKOVIĆ
text: Written. – I accept my colleague Gualtieri's report on the appointment of Faust Parente as CEO of EIOPA and fully support it. I would also like to express my support for EIOPA's work as a supervisory authority working to prevent the risk of destabilising the insurance market and pension system. The protection of insured persons, as well as beneficiaries of the Pension System at European level provided by EIOPA, by supervising authorities in the Member States is of great importance in order to avoid cases of violations of the law by national authorities at the expense of citizens' interests. I am convinced that the appointment of Faust Parente as ceo of EIOPA is a good decision and that this supervisory body under Mr Parente, who already has a successful career behind him in supervisory regulation bodies both internationally and nationally, will continue to effectively protect the interests of European policyholders and pension beneficiaries.

name: Salvatore Domenico POGLIESE
text: in writing. \u2012 The European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) is a body of the European Union. The primary objective of EIOPA is to protect the public interest, contributing to the stability and effectiveness of the financial system, to the benefit of the European Union's economy, its citizens and its businesses.  On 28 January 2016, the Board of Supervisors of EIOPA, at the end of a selection procedure, proposed the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term, in accordance with Article 51(2) and (3) of Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010. I hope that, even following my vote in favour today, the new Executive Director of EIOPA will be able to work with the utmost independence and transparency.

name: Franck PROUST
text: In writing. We have been asked to vote on the appointment of a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (AEAPP). This procedure demonstrates the usefulness of Parliament in exercising its control over the functioning of the bodies dependent on the European institutions.

name: Sofia RIBEIRO
text: in writing. \u2012 This report, which deserved my vote in favour, indicates the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA, after finishing the term of office of the current Director on March 31, 2016.  The appointment of Fausto Parente for a five-year term was proposed following a tender on 28 January 2016.

name: Liliana RODRIGUES
text: in writing. \u2012 The term of office of the current Executive Director of EIOPA ends on March 31, 2016. On January 28, 2016, the Board of Supervisors of EIOPA, following a call for tenders, proposed the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term. The Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing of Fausto Parente and Parliament approved his appointment.

name: Inma RODRÍGUEZ-PIÑERO
text: in writing. I voted in favour of the appointment of Fausto Parente as executive director of the European Insurance and Pensions Authority in view of the current executive director's term ending on 31 March and on 28 January the EESPJ Board of Supervisors, following an open selection procedure, proposed to appoint Fausto Parente to office for a five-year term , and which on 23 February the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs held a hearing with Fausto Parente.

name: Claude ROLIN
text: In writing. Considering that the term of the current Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (AEAPP) expired on 31 March 2016 and that on 28 January 2016, the AEAPP Supervisory Authority had proposed, as part of an open selection procedure, to appoint Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term , the European Parliament's Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs had held its hearing, which proved to be very satisfactory. The European Parliament has therefore approved the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of AEAPP.

name: Bronis ROPĖ
text: Writing. \u2012 I supported the proposal to appoint Faust Parente as the new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) for a five-year term. I note that the candidate appeared well at the hearings held by the EP Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs on 23 February 2016, after which the committee also approved the appointment of Faust Parent as Executive Director of EIOPA.

name: Tokia SAÏFI
text: In writing. I voted in favour of this report which approves the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of AEAPP for a 5-year term.  Prior to this appointment, a hearing by Mr Parente was held in the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs in the European Parliament last February, during which he made an opening statement and had to answer questions from MEPs in preparation for the exercise of this mandate.

name: Lola SÁNCHEZ CALDENTEY
text: in writing. U2012 We abstained in the appointment of this position, as we do not share the general line with which EESPJ functional nor the mandate given to Fausto Parente.

name: Maria Lidia SENRA RODRÍGUEZ
text: in writing. The parliamentary oversight of the activity of the European Insurance and Pensions Authority (ESPJ) is insufficient, so I have decided to abstain in this designation.

name: Remo SERNAGIOTTO
text: in writing. \u2012 The proposal for a decision voted on today provides for the appointment of the new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority, Fausto Parente, for 5 years. Since the candidate was judged sufficiently qualified, I decided to vote in favour of his appointment.

name: Siôn SIMON
text: in writing. ‒ I approve of the appointment of Fausto Parente as the Executive Director of the EIOPA. I believe that he is sufficiently quality to fill this role.

name: Branislav ŠKRIPEK
text: in writing ‒ on the basis of a proposal from the Board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA), I voted in favour of adopting a resolution to appoint Fausto Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA for a period of five years, in line with the position of my political faction of the EKR.

name: Monika SMOLKOVÁ
text: in writing ‒ I supported the appointment of a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority, as the selection of a new candidate was made according to EU standards. The term of office of the current Executive Director expires at the end of March this year and therefore a new candidate had to be found. To this end, the Supervisory Board of EIOPA organised an open selection procedure and, on the basis of its results, proposed to the European Parliament to appoint Faust Parente as its new Executive Director for a five-year term of office. As a candidate for the post, Fausto Parente was questioned by the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs, where he was subjected to questions from committee members. Since Faust Parente has been approved by the Committee as a suitable candidate, I have agreed to appoint him as executive director of EIOPA and I am keeping my fingers crossed for him to perform his duties conscientiously.

name: Igor ŠOLTES
text: Writing. \ u2012 The term of office of the current Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) expires on 31 March 2016. On 28 January 2016, following an open selection procedure, the EIOPA Board of Supervisors proposed that Fausto Parente be appointed Executive Director for a five-year term. Fausto Parente held a presentation in the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs on 23 February 2016. As a suitable candidate, I voted in plenary to adopt the report and thus also supported the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA.

name: Ivan ŠTEFANEC
text: writing \ u2012 I welcome the appointment of Faust Parente as Executive Director of EIOPA and wish him every success in his work.

name: Davor Ivo STIER
text: Written. ‒The term of office of the current CEO of EIOPA expires on 31 March 2016. Following an open selection procedure on 28 January 2016, the EIOPA Board of Supervisors proposed that Fausto Parente be appointed executive director for a term of five years in accordance with Article 51(2) and 3( Regulation. On 23 February 2016 The Economic and Monetary Affairs Committee held a hearing of Faust Parente at which he gave an opening statement and then answered questions from the members of the Committee, and therefore supported the appointment.

name: Dubravka ŠUICA
text: Written. ‒ The Board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) adopted a proposal to appoint an EIOPA Executive Director for a five-year term, and the Committee also proposed in January this year that Fausto Parente be appointed executive director for a term of five years. I support my colleague Gualtieri's report on the proposal to appoint the Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) as I consider Fausto Parente to be an ideal candidate for the post of EIOPA Executive Director.

name: Neoklis SYLIKIOTIS
text: GUE/NGL), in writing. \u2012 We voted to abstain on the appointment of the new Executive Director of the EORA on the ground that we are opposed to the principles that are gathering more and more powers in Brussels.

name: Tibor SZANYI
text: Writing. \u2012 I voted in favour of the report appointing Fausto Parente as Managing Director of EIOPA for the next five-year term of office, given that the term of office of the current Managing Director of EIOPA will expire on 31 March 2016. The decision was also particularly important and timely because the authority cannot be left without a leader simply because it plays an important role, inter alia, through its ongoing, high-level and consistent regulatory and supervisory role. I therefore considered it important to ensure the smooth functioning of the authority with the right candidate.

name: Marc TARABELLA
text: In writing. I voted in favour of the proposal for the appointment of the Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (AEAPP), which is the result of a wide-ranging compromise between political groups.

name: Pavel TELIČKA
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report appointing Fausto Parente as the Executive Director of the EIOPA, which is the EU’s financial regulatory institution. I am confident that Mr Parente will provide a knowledgeable, reliable and forward-thinking leadership to one of the currently most challenging areas for European politics, namely insurance and pensions. In fact, he distinguishes himself through a career in supervisory regulations and policies at national and international level, and is currently Head of the Supervisory Regulation and Policy Directorate at the Italian Insurance Supervisor, IVASS – Istituto di Vigilanza sulle Assicurazioni.

name: Ruža TOMAŠIĆ
text: Written. ‒ The Economic and Monetary Policy Committee held a hearing less than a month ago of Faust Parente, the Italian candidate for Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA), where he gave a presentation and answered questions from members of the Committee.  Given that this is a competent person with experience in supervision at national level, which he acquired as head of the Supervisory Department of the Italian Supervisory Authority (IVASS) and has so far been actively involved in the work of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority, I supported the report on his appointment as the new Executive Director of EIOP.  In this, as in other appointments of the heads of the European institutions, the only criterion they should be guided by is expertise and capacity, as this is the only way for the Institutions of the European Union to do their job correctly and fairly, for the benefit of all nationals.

name: Romana TOMC
text: Writing. I supported the report on the recommendation for the appointment of a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA) as each European body needs a person to lead day-to-day activities. It is important that every European institution has someone who is responsible for implementing the annual work programme and takes the measures necessary to ensure the proper functioning of the authority.

name: Estefanía TORRES MARTÍNEZ
text: in writing. U2012 We abstained in the appointment of this position, as we do not share the general line with which EESPJ functional nor the mandate given to Fausto Parente.

name: Mylène TROSZCZYNSKI
text: In writing. The report endorses the appointment of Mr Fausto Parente as Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority for a five-year term. The President remains Mr. Gabriel Bernardino. I choose abstention on this appointment.

name: István UJHELYI
text: Writing. \u2012 On 28 January 2016, the EIOPA Board of Supervisors proposed the appointment of Fausto Parente as Executive Director after an open tender procedure for a term of five years in office. The Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs heard Fausto Parente, who gave an opening statement and then answered questions from the members of the committee. I voted in favour.

name: Miguel URBÁN CRESPO
text: in writing. U2012 We abstained in the appointment of this position, as we do not share the general line with which EESPJ functional nor the mandate given to Fausto Parente.

name: Ernest URTASUN
text: in writing. ‒ I decided to vote in favour of the appointment of a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority

name: Ivo VAJGL
text: in writing. ‒ I voted in favour of the report on the appointment of a new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority (EIOPA), taking into consideration that the term of office of EIOPA’s current Executive Director ends on 31 March 2016 and that the newly proposed Executive Director for a term of office of five years, Fausto Parente, was chosen following an open selection procedure.

name: Ramón Luis VALCÁRCEL SISO
text: in writing. Taking into account that the Board of Supervisors of the European Insurance and Retirement Pensions Authority (EESPJ), following an open selection procedure, proposed to appoint Fausto Parente as executive director for a 5-year term, in accordance with Article 51(2) and (3) of Regulation (EU) No 1094/2010 and which the Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs of this Parliament held with Fausto Parente a hearing at which Fausto Parente made a preliminary statement and then responded to the questions put by the Parliamentary Committee, I think it is appropriate to vote in favour of his appointment as executive director of EESPJ.

name: Hilde VAUTMANS
text: Written. 'I support the appointment of Fausto Parente as the new Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority. Mr Parente has a long and successful career in this field behind him and I think he will do an excellent job as executive director.

name: Miguel VIEGAS
text: in writing. \u2012 EIOPA is part of the European System of Financial Supervision (ESFS) and aims to support the stability of the financial system and the transparency of markets and financial products. It also seeks to protect policyholders and members and beneficiaries of pension schemes. Creating the illusion that the problems that led to the 2007/2008 financial crisis are resolved, the ESFS has not changed the fundamental issue of financial speculation, as it has not put an end to derivatives markets and tax havens and has not established the separation of commercial banking from investment. History will show that the creation of these European authorities was of little value. For these reasons we have been against the establishment of this system and its authorities. So we abstain from appointing the Executive Director of the authority in question.

name: Harald VILIMSKY
text: Writing. Parente, the current head of the regulatory directorate of the Italian Institute of Insurance Supervision, has had a remarkable career at national and international level. There are no objections to the appointment of him.

name: Theodoros ZAGORAKIS
text: PPE), in writing. \u2012 I supported Mr Gualtieri's proposal, which is supported by the members of the relevant Committee on Economic and Monetary Affairs. This report approves the appointment of the Executive Director of EIOPA.

name: Marco ZANNI
text: in writing. \u2012 Considering that the mandate of the current Executive Director of EIOPA will end on 31 March 2016, on 28 January last the Board of Supervisors of EIOPA, at the end of an open selection procedure, proposed to appoint Fausto Parente as Executive Director for a five-year term. On 23 February, the ECON Committee held a hearing of the candidate and approved his appointment as Executive Director. There are no particular issues to be raised about the candidate's status, but there are still many doubts as to the usefulness of this authority and its actual functioning. That is why I preferred to abstain during the vote in plenary.

name: Milan ZVER
text: Writing. I supported the appointment of the new Executive Director of the European Insurance and Occupational Pensions Authority, Fausto Parente, because I believe that he fulfils all the required criteria and has sufficient experience to take up this function.

name: Krisztina MORVAI
text: – I supported the report on procedural rights for children. There's a problem with the term here. The report speaks of children's rights, given that under the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child, anyone under the age of 18 is a child. We are talking about juveniles in our Hungarian language for 14-18 year olds. But now under-14s can be prosecuted in some cases. As a lawyer, I have experienced the family tragedies that lead to, for example, a child being accused of, say, a simple theft, but he has no right to a trial, no rights of defence, no procedural rights and is therefore completely vulnerable. This can't go on. So I think it is important that this report has been published and I am pleased about it.

name: Jiří POSPÍŠIL
text: – Mr President, I did not support this report for the following reason. I agree with the basic idea of uniform procedural protection for children, but I do not agree with what the directive specifically looks like. And that's for two basic reasons.  Firstly, the scope of the rights thus unified is too broad, for example, the right to privacy is also unified here, and I believe that it should remain the responsibility of individual nation states. For example, in the Czech Republic at the moment there is a debate about whether serious criminals should be, children, anonymous or not. And the second reason is that I find it too important to protect the fact that the European Parliament has extended the category of children to the age of 21. It seems to me that this is already too much protection and that we should stay with the original proposal prepared by the Commission, and that was the age of 18.

name: Andrejs MAMIKINS
text: – Mr President, i would like to begin by congratulating the rapporteur According to official statistics, around one million children are prosecuted each year in the EUROPEAN Union, accounting for around 12% of all persons involved in criminal proceedings in the European Union. In the Member States, both the treatment and the legal component of the criminal proceedings of children vary greatly. Nor does there be a normative definition of the concept of 'fair trial for children'. The aim of the draft proposal for this directive was thus to set minimum rules, to clearly define the whole, to establish an appropriate range of rights for children.
